phrase: Seest thou not how thy Lord dealt with the Companions of the Elephant?
translation: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصْحَابِ الْفِيلِ

phrase: Did He not make their treacherous plan go astray?
translation: أَلَمْ يَجْعَلْ كَيْدَهُمْ فِي تَضْلِيلٍ

phrase: And He sent against them Flights of Birds,
translation: وَأَرْسَلَ عَلَيْهِمْ طَيْرًا أَبَابِيلَ

phrase: Striking them with stones of baked clay.
translation: تَرْمِيهِمْ بِحِجَارَةٍ مِنْ سِجِّيلٍ

phrase: Then did He make them like an empty field of stalks and straw, (of which the corn) has been eaten up.
translation: فَجَعَلَهُمْ كَعَصْفٍ مَأْكُولٍ

phrase: For the covenants (of security and safeguard enjoyed) by the Quraish,
translation: لِإِيلَافِ قُرَيْشٍ

phrase: Their covenants (covering) journeys by winter and summer,-
translation: إِيلَافِهِمْ رِحْلَةَ الشِّتَاءِ وَالصَّيْفِ

phrase: Let them adore the Lord of this House,
translation: فَلْيَعْبُدُوا رَبَّ هَٰذَا الْبَيْتِ

phrase: Who provides them with food against hunger, and with security against fear (of danger).
translation: الَّذِي أَطْعَمَهُمْ مِنْ جُوعٍ وَآمَنَهُمْ مِنْ خَوْفٍ

phrase: Seest thou one who denies the Judgment (to come)?
translation: أَرَأَيْتَ الَّذِي يُكَذِّبُ بِالدِّينِ

phrase: Then such is the (man) who repulses the orphan (with harshness),
translation: فَذَٰلِكَ الَّذِي يَدُعُّ الْيَتِيمَ

phrase: And encourages not the feeding of the indigent.
translation: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ الْمِسْكِينِ

phrase: So woe to the worshippers
translation: فَوَيْلٌ لِلْمُصَلِّينَ

phrase: Who are neglectful of their prayers,
translation: الَّذِينَ هُمْ عَنْ صَلَاتِهِمْ سَاهُونَ

phrase: Those who (want but) to be seen (of men),
translation: الَّذِينَ هُمْ يُرَاءُونَ

phrase: But refuse (to supply) (even) neighbourly needs.
translation: وَيَمْنَعُونَ الْمَاعُونَ

phrase: To thee have We granted the Fount (of Abundance).
translation: إِنَّا أَعْطَيْنَاكَ الْكَوْثَرَ

phrase: Therefore to thy Lord turn in Prayer and Sacrifice.
translation: فَصَلِّ لِرَبِّكَ وَانْحَرْ

phrase: For he who hateth thee, he will be cut off (from Future Hope).
translation: إِنَّ شَانِئَكَ هُوَ الْأَبْتَرُ

phrase: Say : O ye that reject Faith!
translation: قُلْ يَا أَيُّهَا الْكَافِرُونَ

phrase: I worship not that which ye worship,
translation: لَا أَعْبُدُ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ

phrase: Nor will ye worship that which I worship.
translation: وَلَا أَنْتُمْ عَابِدُونَ مَا أَعْبُدُ

phrase: And I will not worship that which ye have been wont to worship,
translation: وَلَا أَنَا عَابِدٌ مَا عَبَدْتُمْ

phrase: To you be your Way, and to me mine.
translation: لَكُمْ دِينُكُمْ وَلِيَ دِينِ

phrase: When comes the Help of Allah, and Victory,
translation: إِذَا جَاءَ نَصْرُ اللَّهِ وَالْفَتْحُ

phrase: And thou dost see the people enter Allah´s Religion in crowds,
translation: وَرَأَيْتَ النَّاسَ يَدْخُلُونَ فِي دِينِ اللَّهِ أَفْوَاجًا

phrase: Celebrate the praises of thy Lord, and pray for His Forgiveness: For He is Oft-Returning (in Grace and Mercy).
translation: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَاسْتَغْفِرْهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ تَوَّابًا

phrase: Perish the hands of the Father of Flame! Perish he!
translation: تَبَّتْ يَدَا أَبِي لَهَبٍ وَتَبَّ

phrase: No profit to him from all his wealth, and all his gains!
translation: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُ مَالُهُ وَمَا كَسَبَ

phrase: Burnt soon will he be in a Fire of Blazing Flame!
translation: سَيَصْلَىٰ نَارًا ذَاتَ لَهَبٍ

phrase: His wife shall carry the (crackling) wood - As fuel!-
translation: وَامْرَأَتُهُ حَمَّالَةَ الْحَطَبِ

phrase: A twisted rope of palm-leaf fibre round her (own) neck!
translation: فِي جِيدِهَا حَبْلٌ مِنْ مَسَدٍ

phrase: Say: He is Allah, the One and Only;
translation: قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ

phrase: Allah, the Eternal, Absolute;
translation: اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ

phrase: He begetteth not, nor is He begotten;
translation: لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ

phrase: And there is none like unto Him.
translation: وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ

phrase: Say: I seek refuge with the Lord of the Dawn
translation: قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ

phrase: From the mischief of created things;
translation: مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ

phrase: From the mischief of Darkness as it overspreads;
translation: وَمِنْ شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ

phrase: From the mischief of those who practise secret arts;
translation: وَمِنْ شَرِّ النَّفَّاثَاتِ فِي الْعُقَدِ

phrase: And from the mischief of the envious one as he practises envy.
translation: وَمِنْ شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ

phrase: Say: I seek refuge with the Lord and Cherisher of Mankind,
translation: قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ

phrase: The King (or Ruler) of Mankind,
translation: مَلِكِ النَّاسِ

phrase: The god (or judge) of Mankind,-
translation: إِلَٰهِ النَّاسِ

phrase: From the mischief of the Whisperer (of Evil), who withdraws (after his whisper),-
translation: مِنْ شَرِّ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ

phrase: (The same) who whispers into the hearts of Mankind,-
translation: الَّذِي يُوَسْوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ النَّاسِ

phrase: Among Jinns and among men.
translation: مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ

phrase: By the Glorious Morning Light,
translation: وَالضُّحَىٰ

phrase: And by the Night when it is still,-
translation: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا سَجَىٰ

phrase: Thy Guardian-Lord hath not forsaken thee, nor is He displeased.
translation: مَا وَدَّعَكَ رَبُّكَ وَمَا قَلَىٰ

phrase: And verily the Hereafter will be better for thee than the present.
translation: وَلَلْآخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ لَكَ مِنَ الْأُولَىٰ

phrase: And soon will thy Guardian-Lord give thee (that wherewith) thou shalt be well-pleased.
translation: وَلَسَوْفَ يُعْطِيكَ رَبُّكَ فَتَرْضَىٰ

phrase: Did He not find thee an orphan and give thee shelter (and care)?
translation: أَلَمْ يَجِدْكَ يَتِيمًا فَآوَىٰ

phrase: And He found thee wandering, and He gave thee guidance.
translation: وَوَجَدَكَ ضَالًّا فَهَدَىٰ

phrase: And He found thee in need, and made thee independent.
translation: وَوَجَدَكَ عَائِلًا فَأَغْنَىٰ

phrase: Therefore, treat not the orphan with harshness,
translation: فَأَمَّا الْيَتِيمَ فَلَا تَقْهَرْ

phrase: Nor repulse the petitioner (unheard);
translation: وَأَمَّا السَّائِلَ فَلَا تَنْهَرْ

phrase: But the bounty of the Lord - rehearse and proclaim!
translation: وَأَمَّا بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ فَحَدِّثْ

phrase: Have We not expanded thee thy breast?-
translation: أَلَمْ نَشْرَحْ لَكَ صَدْرَكَ

phrase: And removed from thee thy burden
translation: وَوَضَعْنَا عَنْكَ وِزْرَكَ

phrase: The which did gall thy back?-
translation: الَّذِي أَنْقَضَ ظَهْرَكَ

phrase: And raised high the esteem (in which) thou (art held)?
translation: وَرَفَعْنَا لَكَ ذِكْرَكَ

phrase: So, verily, with every difficulty, there is relief:
translation: فَإِنَّ مَعَ الْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا

phrase: Verily, with every difficulty there is relief.
translation: إِنَّ مَعَ الْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا

phrase: Therefore, when thou art free (from thine immediate task), still labour hard,
translation: فَإِذَا فَرَغْتَ فَانْصَبْ

phrase: And to thy Lord turn (all) thy attention.
translation: وَإِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَارْغَبْ

phrase: By the Fig and the Olive,
translation: وَالتِّينِ وَالزَّيْتُونِ

phrase: And the Mount of Sinai,
translation: وَطُورِ سِينِينَ

phrase: And this City of security,-
translation: وَهَٰذَا الْبَلَدِ الْأَمِينِ

phrase: We have indeed created man in the best of moulds,
translation: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ فِي أَحْسَنِ تَقْوِيمٍ

phrase: Then do We abase him (to be) the lowest of the low,-
translation: ثُمَّ رَدَدْنَاهُ أَسْفَلَ سَافِلِينَ

phrase: Except such as believe and do righteous deeds: For they shall have a reward unfailing.
translation: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ فَلَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ

phrase: Then what can, after this, contradict thee, as to the judgment (to come)?
translation: فَمَا يُكَذِّبُكَ بَعْدُ بِالدِّينِ

phrase: Is not Allah the wisest of judges?
translation: أَلَيْسَ اللَّهُ بِأَحْكَمِ الْحَاكِمِينَ

phrase: Proclaim! (or read!) in the name of thy Lord and Cherisher, Who created-
translation: اقْرَأْ بِاسْمِ رَبِّكَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ

phrase: Created man, out of a (mere) clot of congealed blood:
translation: خَلَقَ الْإِنْسَانَ مِنْ عَلَقٍ

phrase: Proclaim! And thy Lord is Most Bountiful,-
translation: اقْرَأْ وَرَبُّكَ الْأَكْرَمُ

phrase: He Who taught (the use of) the pen,-
translation: الَّذِي عَلَّمَ بِالْقَلَمِ

phrase: Taught man that which he knew not.
translation: عَلَّمَ الْإِنْسَانَ مَا لَمْ يَعْلَمْ

phrase: Day, but man doth transgress all bounds,
translation: كَلَّا إِنَّ الْإِنْسَانَ لَيَطْغَىٰ

phrase: In that he looketh upon himself as self-sufficient.
translation: أَنْ رَآهُ اسْتَغْنَىٰ

phrase: Verily, to thy Lord is the return (of all).
translation: إِنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ الرُّجْعَىٰ

phrase: Seest thou one who forbids-
translation: أَرَأَيْتَ الَّذِي يَنْهَىٰ

phrase: A votary when he (turns) to pray?
translation: عَبْدًا إِذَا صَلَّىٰ

phrase: Seest thou if he is on (the road of) Guidance?-
translation: أَرَأَيْتَ إِنْ كَانَ عَلَى الْهُدَىٰ

phrase: Or enjoins Righteousness?
translation: أَوْ أَمَرَ بِالتَّقْوَىٰ

phrase: Seest thou if he denies (Truth) and turns away?
translation: أَرَأَيْتَ إِنْ كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ

phrase: Knoweth he not that Allah doth see?
translation: أَلَمْ يَعْلَمْ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ يَرَىٰ

phrase: Let him beware! If he desist not, We will drag him by the forelock,-
translation: كَلَّا لَئِنْ لَمْ يَنْتَهِ لَنَسْفَعًا بِالنَّاصِيَةِ

phrase: A lying, sinful forelock!
translation: نَاصِيَةٍ كَاذِبَةٍ خَاطِئَةٍ

phrase: Then, let him call (for help) to his council (of comrades):
translation: فَلْيَدْعُ نَادِيَهُ

phrase: We will call on the angels of punishment (to deal with him)!
translation: سَنَدْعُ الزَّبَانِيَةَ

phrase: Day, heed him not: But bow down in adoration, and bring thyself the closer (to Allah)!
translation: كَلَّا لَا تُطِعْهُ وَاسْجُدْ وَاقْتَرِبْ ۩

phrase: We have indeed revealed this (Message) in the Night of Power:
translation: إِنَّا أَنْزَلْنَاهُ فِي لَيْلَةِ الْقَدْرِ

phrase: And what will explain to thee what the night of power is?
translation: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا لَيْلَةُ الْقَدْرِ

phrase: The Night of Power is better than a thousand months.
translation: لَيْلَةُ الْقَدْرِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ أَلْفِ شَهْرٍ

phrase: Therein come down the angels and the Spirit by Allah´s permission, on every errand:
translation: تَنَزَّلُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَالرُّوحُ فِيهَا بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِمْ مِنْ كُلِّ أَمْرٍ

phrase: Peace!...This until the rise of morn!
translation: سَلَامٌ هِيَ حَتَّىٰ مَطْلَعِ الْفَجْرِ

phrase: Those who reject (Truth), among the People of the Book and among the Polytheists, were not going to depart (from their ways) until there should come to them Clear Evidence,-
translation: لَمْ يَكُنِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ وَالْمُشْرِكِينَ مُنْفَكِّينَ حَتَّىٰ تَأْتِيَهُمُ الْبَيِّنَةُ

phrase: An messenger from Allah, rehearsing scriptures kept pure and holy:
translation: رَسُولٌ مِنَ اللَّهِ يَتْلُو صُحُفًا مُطَهَّرَةً

phrase: Wherein are laws (or decrees) right and straight.
translation: فِيهَا كُتُبٌ قَيِّمَةٌ

phrase: Nor did the People of the Book make schisms, until after there came to them Clear Evidence.
translation: وَمَا تَفَرَّقَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ إِلَّا مِنْ بَعْدِ مَا جَاءَتْهُمُ الْبَيِّنَةُ

phrase: And they have been commanded no more than this: To worship Allah, offering Him sincere devotion, being true (in faith); to establish regular prayer; and to practise regular charity; and that is the Religion Right and Straight.
translation: وَمَا أُمِرُوا إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ الدِّينَ حُنَفَاءَ وَيُقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَيُؤْتُوا الزَّكَاةَ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ دِينُ الْقَيِّمَةِ

phrase: Those who reject (Truth), among the People of the Book and among the Polytheists, will be in Hell-Fire, to dwell therein (for aye). They are the worst of creatures.
translation: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ وَالْمُشْرِكِينَ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمْ شَرُّ الْبَرِيَّةِ

phrase: Those who have faith and do righteous deeds,- they are the best of creatures.
translation: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمْ خَيْرُ الْبَرِيَّةِ

phrase: Their reward is with Allah: Gardens of Eternity, beneath which rivers flow; they will dwell therein for ever; Allah well pleased with them, and they with Him: all this for such as fear their Lord and Cherisher.
translation: جَزَاؤُهُمْ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّاتُ عَدْنٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا ۖ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُمْ وَرَضُوا عَنْهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَنْ خَشِيَ رَبَّهُ

phrase: When the earth is shaken to her (utmost) convulsion,
translation: إِذَا زُلْزِلَتِ الْأَرْضُ زِلْزَالَهَا

phrase: And the earth throws up her burdens (from within),
translation: وَأَخْرَجَتِ الْأَرْضُ أَثْقَالَهَا

phrase: And man cries (distressed): ´What is the matter with her?´-
translation: وَقَالَ الْإِنْسَانُ مَا لَهَا

phrase: On that Day will she declare her tidings:
translation: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُحَدِّثُ أَخْبَارَهَا

phrase: For that thy Lord will have given her inspiration.
translation: بِأَنَّ رَبَّكَ أَوْحَىٰ لَهَا

phrase: On that Day will men proceed in companies sorted out, to be shown the deeds that they (had done).
translation: يَوْمَئِذٍ يَصْدُرُ النَّاسُ أَشْتَاتًا لِيُرَوْا أَعْمَالَهُمْ

phrase: Then shall anyone who has done an atom´s weight of good, see it!
translation: فَمَنْ يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًا يَرَهُ

phrase: And anyone who has done an atom´s weight of evil, shall see it.
translation: وَمَنْ يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ شَرًّا يَرَهُ

phrase: By the (Steeds) that run, with panting (breath),
translation: وَالْعَادِيَاتِ ضَبْحًا

phrase: And strike sparks of fire,
translation: فَالْمُورِيَاتِ قَدْحًا

phrase: And push home the charge in the morning,
translation: فَالْمُغِيرَاتِ صُبْحًا

phrase: And raise the dust in clouds the while,
translation: فَأَثَرْنَ بِهِ نَقْعًا

phrase: And penetrate forthwith into the midst (of the foe) en masse;-
translation: فَوَسَطْنَ بِهِ جَمْعًا

phrase: Truly man is, to his Lord, ungrateful;
translation: إِنَّ الْإِنْسَانَ لِرَبِّهِ لَكَنُودٌ

phrase: And to that (fact) he bears witness (by his deeds);
translation: وَإِنَّهُ عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكَ لَشَهِيدٌ

phrase: And violent is he in his love of wealth.
translation: وَإِنَّهُ لِحُبِّ الْخَيْرِ لَشَدِيدٌ

phrase: Does he not know,- when that which is in the graves is scattered abroad
translation: أَفَلَا يَعْلَمُ إِذَا بُعْثِرَ مَا فِي الْقُبُورِ

phrase: And that which is (locked up) in (human) breasts is made manifest-
translation: وَحُصِّلَ مَا فِي الصُّدُورِ

phrase: That their Lord had been Well-acquainted with them, (even to) that Day?
translation: إِنَّ رَبَّهُمْ بِهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَخَبِيرٌ

phrase: The (Day) of Noise and Clamour:
translation: الْقَارِعَةُ

phrase: What is the (Day) of Noise and Clamour?
translation: مَا الْقَارِعَةُ

phrase: And what will explain to thee what the (Day) of Noise and Clamour is?
translation: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الْقَارِعَةُ

phrase: (It is) a Day whereon men will be like moths scattered about,
translation: يَوْمَ يَكُونُ النَّاسُ كَالْفَرَاشِ الْمَبْثُوثِ

phrase: And the mountains will be like carded wool.
translation: وَتَكُونُ الْجِبَالُ كَالْعِهْنِ الْمَنْفُوشِ

phrase: Then, he whose balance (of good deeds) will be (found) heavy,
translation: فَأَمَّا مَنْ ثَقُلَتْ مَوَازِينُهُ

phrase: Will be in a life of good pleasure and satisfaction.
translation: فَهُوَ فِي عِيشَةٍ رَاضِيَةٍ

phrase: But he whose balance (of good deeds) will be (found) light,-
translation: وَأَمَّا مَنْ خَفَّتْ مَوَازِينُهُ

phrase: Will have his home in a (bottomless) Pit.
translation: فَأُمُّهُ هَاوِيَةٌ

phrase: And what will explain to thee what this is?
translation: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا هِيَهْ

phrase: (It is) a Fire Blazing fiercely!
translation: نَارٌ حَامِيَةٌ

phrase: The mutual rivalry for piling up (the good things of this world) diverts you (from the more serious things),
translation: أَلْهَاكُمُ التَّكَاثُرُ

phrase: Until ye visit the graves.
translation: حَتَّىٰ زُرْتُمُ الْمَقَابِرَ

phrase: But nay, ye soon shall know (the reality).
translation: كَلَّا سَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ

phrase: Again, ye soon shall know!
translation: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ

phrase: Nay, were ye to know with certainty of mind, (ye would beware!)
translation: كَلَّا لَوْ تَعْلَمُونَ عِلْمَ الْيَقِينِ

phrase: Ye shall certainly see Hell-Fire!
translation: لَتَرَوُنَّ الْجَحِيمَ

phrase: Again, ye shall see it with certainty of sight!
translation: ثُمَّ لَتَرَوُنَّهَا عَيْنَ الْيَقِينِ

phrase: Then, shall ye be questioned that Day about the joy (ye indulged in!).
translation: ثُمَّ لَتُسْأَلُنَّ يَوْمَئِذٍ عَنِ النَّعِيمِ

phrase: By (the Token of) Time (through the ages),
translation: وَالْعَصْرِ

phrase: Verily Man is in loss,
translation: إِنَّ الْإِنْسَانَ لَفِي خُسْرٍ

phrase: Except such as have Faith, and do righteous deeds, and (join together) in the mutual teaching of Truth, and of Patience and Constancy.
translation: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالْحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالصَّبْرِ

phrase: Woe to every (kind of) scandal-monger and-backbiter,
translation: وَيْلٌ لِكُلِّ هُمَزَةٍ لُمَزَةٍ

phrase: Who pileth up wealth and layeth it by,
translation: الَّذِي جَمَعَ مَالًا وَعَدَّدَهُ

phrase: Thinking that his wealth would make him last for ever!
translation: يَحْسَبُ أَنَّ مَالَهُ أَخْلَدَهُ

phrase: By no means! He will be sure to be thrown into That which Breaks to Pieces,
translation: كَلَّا ۖ لَيُنْبَذَنَّ فِي الْحُطَمَةِ

phrase: And what will explain to thee That which Breaks to Pieces?
translation: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الْحُطَمَةُ

phrase: (It is) the Fire of (the Wrath of) Allah kindled (to a blaze),
translation: نَارُ اللَّهِ الْمُوقَدَةُ

phrase: The which doth mount (Right) to the Hearts:
translation: الَّتِي تَطَّلِعُ عَلَى الْأَفْئِدَةِ

phrase: It shall be made into a vault over them,
translation: إِنَّهَا عَلَيْهِمْ مُؤْصَدَةٌ

phrase: In columns outstretched.
translation: فِي عَمَدٍ مُمَدَّدَةٍ

phrase: Concerning what are they disputing?
translation: عَمَّ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ

phrase: Concerning the Great News,
translation: عَنِ النَّبَإِ الْعَظِيمِ

phrase: About which they cannot agree.
translation: الَّذِي هُمْ فِيهِ مُخْتَلِفُونَ

phrase: Verily, they shall soon (come to) know!
translation: كَلَّا سَيَعْلَمُونَ

phrase: Verily, verily they shall soon (come to) know!
translation: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَيَعْلَمُونَ

phrase: Have We not made the earth as a wide expanse,
translation: أَلَمْ نَجْعَلِ الْأَرْضَ مِهَادًا

phrase: And the mountains as pegs?
translation: وَالْجِبَالَ أَوْتَادًا

phrase: And (have We not) created you in pairs,
translation: وَخَلَقْنَاكُمْ أَزْوَاجًا

phrase: And made your sleep for rest,
translation: وَجَعَلْنَا نَوْمَكُمْ سُبَاتًا

phrase: And made the night as a covering,
translation: وَجَعَلْنَا اللَّيْلَ لِبَاسًا

phrase: And made the day as a means of subsistence?
translation: وَجَعَلْنَا النَّهَارَ مَعَاشًا

phrase: And (have We not) built over you the seven firmaments,
translation: وَبَنَيْنَا فَوْقَكُمْ سَبْعًا شِدَادًا

phrase: And placed (therein) a Light of Splendour?
translation: وَجَعَلْنَا سِرَاجًا وَهَّاجًا

phrase: And do We not send down from the clouds water in abundance,
translation: وَأَنْزَلْنَا مِنَ الْمُعْصِرَاتِ مَاءً ثَجَّاجًا

phrase: That We may produce therewith corn and vegetables,
translation: لِنُخْرِجَ بِهِ حَبًّا وَنَبَاتًا

phrase: And gardens of luxurious growth?
translation: وَجَنَّاتٍ أَلْفَافًا

phrase: Verily the Day of Sorting out is a thing appointed,
translation: إِنَّ يَوْمَ الْفَصْلِ كَانَ مِيقَاتًا

phrase: The Day that the Trumpet shall be sounded, and ye shall come forth in crowds;
translation: يَوْمَ يُنْفَخُ فِي الصُّورِ فَتَأْتُونَ أَفْوَاجًا

phrase: And the heavens shall be opened as if there were doors,
translation: وَفُتِحَتِ السَّمَاءُ فَكَانَتْ أَبْوَابًا

phrase: And the mountains shall vanish, as if they were a mirage.
translation: وَسُيِّرَتِ الْجِبَالُ فَكَانَتْ سَرَابًا

phrase: Truly Hell is as a place of ambush,
translation: إِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ كَانَتْ مِرْصَادًا

phrase: For the transgressors a place of destination:
translation: لِلطَّاغِينَ مَآبًا

phrase: They will dwell therein for ages.
translation: لَابِثِينَ فِيهَا أَحْقَابًا

phrase: Nothing cool shall they taste therein, nor any drink,
translation: لَا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا بَرْدًا وَلَا شَرَابًا

phrase: Save a boiling fluid and a fluid, dark, murky, intensely cold,
translation: إِلَّا حَمِيمًا وَغَسَّاقًا

phrase: A fitting recompense (for them).
translation: جَزَاءً وِفَاقًا

phrase: For that they used not to fear any account (for their deeds),
translation: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا لَا يَرْجُونَ حِسَابًا

phrase: But they (impudently) treated Our Signs as false.
translation: وَكَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا كِذَّابًا

phrase: And all things have We preserved on record.
translation: وَكُلَّ شَيْءٍ أَحْصَيْنَاهُ كِتَابًا

phrase: "So taste ye (the fruits of your deeds); for no increase shall We grant you, except in Punishment."
translation: فَذُوقُوا فَلَنْ نَزِيدَكُمْ إِلَّا عَذَابًا

phrase: Verily for the Righteous there will be a fulfilment of (the heart´s) desires;
translation: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ مَفَازًا

phrase: Gardens enclosed, and grapevines;
translation: حَدَائِقَ وَأَعْنَابًا

phrase: And voluptuous women of equal age;
translation: وَكَوَاعِبَ أَتْرَابًا

phrase: And a cup full (to the brim).
translation: وَكَأْسًا دِهَاقًا

phrase: No vanity shall they hear therein, nor Untruth:-
translation: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا كِذَّابًا

phrase: Recompense from thy Lord, a gift, (amply) sufficient,
translation: جَزَاءً مِنْ رَبِّكَ عَطَاءً حِسَابًا

phrase: (From) the Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all between, (Allah) Most Gracious: None shall have power to argue with Him.
translation: رَبِّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا الرَّحْمَٰنِ ۖ لَا يَمْلِكُونَ مِنْهُ خِطَابًا

phrase: The Day that the Spirit and the angels will stand forth in ranks, none shall speak except any who is permitted by (Allah) Most Gracious, and He will say what is right.
translation: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ الرُّوحُ وَالْمَلَائِكَةُ صَفًّا ۖ لَا يَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلَّا مَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُ الرَّحْمَٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَابًا

phrase: That Day will be the sure Reality: Therefore, whoso will, let him take a (straight) return to his Lord!
translation: ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمُ الْحَقُّ ۖ فَمَنْ شَاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ مَآبًا

phrase: Verily, We have warned you of a Penalty near, the Day when man will see (the deeds) which his hands have sent forth, and the Unbeliever will say, "Woe unto me! Would that I were (metre) dust!"
translation: إِنَّا أَنْذَرْنَاكُمْ عَذَابًا قَرِيبًا يَوْمَ يَنْظُرُ الْمَرْءُ مَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاهُ وَيَقُولُ الْكَافِرُ يَا لَيْتَنِي كُنْتُ تُرَابًا

phrase: By the (angels) who tear out (the souls of the wicked) with violence;
translation: وَالنَّازِعَاتِ غَرْقًا

phrase: By those who gently draw out (the souls of the blessed);
translation: وَالنَّاشِطَاتِ نَشْطًا

phrase: And by those who glide along (on errands of mercy),
translation: وَالسَّابِحَاتِ سَبْحًا

phrase: Then press forward as in a race,
translation: فَالسَّابِقَاتِ سَبْقًا

phrase: Then arrange to do (the Commands of their Lord),
translation: فَالْمُدَبِّرَاتِ أَمْرًا

phrase: One Day everything that can be in commotion will be in violent commotion,
translation: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ الرَّاجِفَةُ

phrase: Followed by oft-repeated (commotions):
translation: تَتْبَعُهَا الرَّادِفَةُ

phrase: Hearts that Day will be in agitation;
translation: قُلُوبٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَاجِفَةٌ

phrase: Cast down will be (their owners´) eyes.
translation: أَبْصَارُهَا خَاشِعَةٌ

phrase: They say (now): "What! shall we indeed be returned to (our) former state?
translation: يَقُولُونَ أَإِنَّا لَمَرْدُودُونَ فِي الْحَافِرَةِ

phrase: "What! - when we shall have become rotten bones?"
translation: أَإِذَا كُنَّا عِظَامًا نَخِرَةً

phrase: They say: "It would, in that case, be a return with loss!"
translation: قَالُوا تِلْكَ إِذًا كَرَّةٌ خَاسِرَةٌ

phrase: But verily, it will be but a single (Compelling) Cry,
translation: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجْرَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ

phrase: When, behold, they will be in the (full) awakening (to Judgment).
translation: فَإِذَا هُمْ بِالسَّاهِرَةِ

phrase: Has the story of Moses reached thee?
translation: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ مُوسَىٰ

phrase: Behold, thy Lord did call to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa:-
translation: إِذْ نَادَاهُ رَبُّهُ بِالْوَادِ الْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى

phrase: "Go thou to Pharaoh for he has indeed transgressed all bounds:
translation: اذْهَبْ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُ طَغَىٰ

phrase: "And say to him, ´Wouldst thou that thou shouldst be purified (from sin)?-
translation: فَقُلْ هَلْ لَكَ إِلَىٰ أَنْ تَزَكَّىٰ

phrase: "´And that I guide thee to thy Lord, so thou shouldst fear Him?´"
translation: وَأَهْدِيَكَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَتَخْشَىٰ

phrase: Then did (Moses) show him the Great Sign.
translation: فَأَرَاهُ الْآيَةَ الْكُبْرَىٰ

phrase: But (Pharaoh) rejected it and disobeyed (guidance);
translation: فَكَذَّبَ وَعَصَىٰ

phrase: Further, he turned his back, striving hard (against Allah).
translation: ثُمَّ أَدْبَرَ يَسْعَىٰ

phrase: Then he collected (his men) and made a proclamation,
translation: فَحَشَرَ فَنَادَىٰ

phrase: Saying, "I am your Lord, Most High".
translation: فَقَالَ أَنَا رَبُّكُمُ الْأَعْلَىٰ

phrase: But Allah did punish him, (and made an) example of him, - in the Hereafter, as in this life.
translation: فَأَخَذَهُ اللَّهُ نَكَالَ الْآخِرَةِ وَالْأُولَىٰ

phrase: Verily in this is an instructive warning for whosoever feareth (Allah).
translation: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِمَنْ يَخْشَىٰ

phrase: What! Are ye the more difficult to create or the heaven (above)? (Allah) hath constructed it:
translation: أَأَنْتُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَمِ السَّمَاءُ ۚ بَنَاهَا

phrase: On high hath He raised its canopy, and He hath given it order and perfection.
translation: رَفَعَ سَمْكَهَا فَسَوَّاهَا

phrase: Its night doth He endow with darkness, and its splendour doth He bring out (with light).
translation: وَأَغْطَشَ لَيْلَهَا وَأَخْرَجَ ضُحَاهَا

phrase: And the earth, moreover, hath He extended (to a wide expanse);
translation: وَالْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ دَحَاهَا

phrase: He draweth out therefrom its moisture and its pasture;
translation: أَخْرَجَ مِنْهَا مَاءَهَا وَمَرْعَاهَا

phrase: And the mountains hath He firmly fixed;-
translation: وَالْجِبَالَ أَرْسَاهَا

phrase: For use and convenience to you and your cattle.
translation: مَتَاعًا لَكُمْ وَلِأَنْعَامِكُمْ

phrase: Therefore, when there comes the great, overwhelming (Event),-
translation: فَإِذَا جَاءَتِ الطَّامَّةُ الْكُبْرَىٰ

phrase: The Day when man shall remember (all) that he strove for,
translation: يَوْمَ يَتَذَكَّرُ الْإِنْسَانُ مَا سَعَىٰ

phrase: And Hell-Fire shall be placed in full view for (all) to see,-
translation: وَبُرِّزَتِ الْجَحِيمُ لِمَنْ يَرَىٰ

phrase: Then, for such as had transgressed all bounds,
translation: فَأَمَّا مَنْ طَغَىٰ

phrase: And had preferred the life of this world,
translation: وَآثَرَ الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا

phrase: The Abode will be Hell-Fire;
translation: فَإِنَّ الْجَحِيمَ هِيَ الْمَأْوَىٰ

phrase: And for such as had entertained the fear of standing before their Lord´s (tribunal) and had restrained (their) soul from lower desires,
translation: وَأَمَّا مَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِ وَنَهَى النَّفْسَ عَنِ الْهَوَىٰ

phrase: Their abode will be the Garden.
translation: فَإِنَّ الْجَنَّةَ هِيَ الْمَأْوَىٰ

phrase: They ask thee about the Hour,-´When will be its appointed time?
translation: يَسْأَلُونَكَ عَنِ السَّاعَةِ أَيَّانَ مُرْسَاهَا

phrase: Wherein art thou (concerned) with the declaration thereof?
translation: فِيمَ أَنْتَ مِنْ ذِكْرَاهَا

phrase: With thy Lord in the Limit fixed therefor.
translation: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ مُنْتَهَاهَا

phrase: Thou art but a Warner for such as fear it.
translation: إِنَّمَا أَنْتَ مُنْذِرُ مَنْ يَخْشَاهَا

phrase: The Day they see it, (It will be) as if they had tarried but a single evening, or (at most till) the following morn!
translation: كَأَنَّهُمْ يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَهَا لَمْ يَلْبَثُوا إِلَّا عَشِيَّةً أَوْ ضُحَاهَا

phrase: (The Prophet) frowned and turned away,
translation: عَبَسَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ

phrase: Because there came to him the blind man (interrupting).
translation: أَنْ جَاءَهُ الْأَعْمَىٰ

phrase: But what could tell thee but that perchance he might grow (in spiritual understanding)?-
translation: وَمَا يُدْرِيكَ لَعَلَّهُ يَزَّكَّىٰ

phrase: Or that he might receive admonition, and the teaching might profit him?
translation: أَوْ يَذَّكَّرُ فَتَنْفَعَهُ الذِّكْرَىٰ

phrase: As to one who regards Himself as self-sufficient,
translation: أَمَّا مَنِ اسْتَغْنَىٰ

phrase: To him dost thou attend;
translation: فَأَنْتَ لَهُ تَصَدَّىٰ

phrase: Though it is no blame to thee if he grow not (in spiritual understanding).
translation: وَمَا عَلَيْكَ أَلَّا يَزَّكَّىٰ

phrase: But as to him who came to thee striving earnestly,
translation: وَأَمَّا مَنْ جَاءَكَ يَسْعَىٰ

phrase: And with fear (in his heart),
translation: وَهُوَ يَخْشَىٰ

phrase: Of him wast thou unmindful.
translation: فَأَنْتَ عَنْهُ تَلَهَّىٰ

phrase: By no means (should it be so)! For it is indeed a Message of instruction:
translation: كَلَّا إِنَّهَا تَذْكِرَةٌ

phrase: Therefore let whoso will, keep it in remembrance.
translation: فَمَنْ شَاءَ ذَكَرَهُ

phrase: (It is) in Books held (greatly) in honour,
translation: فِي صُحُفٍ مُكَرَّمَةٍ

phrase: Exalted (in dignity), kept pure and holy,
translation: مَرْفُوعَةٍ مُطَهَّرَةٍ

phrase: (Written) by the hands of scribes-
translation: بِأَيْدِي سَفَرَةٍ

phrase: Honourable and Pious and Just.
translation: كِرَامٍ بَرَرَةٍ

phrase: Woe to man! What hath made him reject Allah;
translation: قُتِلَ الْإِنْسَانُ مَا أَكْفَرَهُ

phrase: From what stuff hath He created him?
translation: مِنْ أَيِّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقَهُ

phrase: From a sperm-drop: He hath created him, and then mouldeth him in due proportions;
translation: مِنْ نُطْفَةٍ خَلَقَهُ فَقَدَّرَهُ

phrase: Then doth He make His path smooth for him;
translation: ثُمَّ السَّبِيلَ يَسَّرَهُ

phrase: Then He causeth him to die, and putteth him in his grave;
translation: ثُمَّ أَمَاتَهُ فَأَقْبَرَهُ

phrase: Then, when it is His Will, He will raise him up (again).
translation: ثُمَّ إِذَا شَاءَ أَنْشَرَهُ

phrase: By no means hath he fulfilled what Allah hath commanded him.
translation: كَلَّا لَمَّا يَقْضِ مَا أَمَرَهُ

phrase: Then let man look at his food, (and how We provide it):
translation: فَلْيَنْظُرِ الْإِنْسَانُ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِهِ

phrase: For that We pour forth water in abundance,
translation: أَنَّا صَبَبْنَا الْمَاءَ صَبًّا

phrase: And We split the earth in fragments,
translation: ثُمَّ شَقَقْنَا الْأَرْضَ شَقًّا

phrase: And produce therein corn,
translation: فَأَنْبَتْنَا فِيهَا حَبًّا

phrase: And Grapes and nutritious plants,
translation: وَعِنَبًا وَقَضْبًا

phrase: And Olives and Dates,
translation: وَزَيْتُونًا وَنَخْلًا

phrase: And enclosed Gardens, dense with lofty trees,
translation: وَحَدَائِقَ غُلْبًا

phrase: And fruits and fodder,-
translation: وَفَاكِهَةً وَأَبًّا

phrase: At length, when there comes the Deafening Noise,-
translation: فَإِذَا جَاءَتِ الصَّاخَّةُ

phrase: That Day shall a man flee from his own brother,
translation: يَوْمَ يَفِرُّ الْمَرْءُ مِنْ أَخِيهِ

phrase: And from his mother and his father,
translation: وَأُمِّهِ وَأَبِيهِ

phrase: And from his wife and his children.
translation: وَصَاحِبَتِهِ وَبَنِيهِ

phrase: Each one of them, that Day, will have enough concern (of his own) to make him indifferent to the others.
translation: لِكُلِّ امْرِئٍ مِنْهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ شَأْنٌ يُغْنِيهِ

phrase: Some faces that Day will be beaming,
translation: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ مُسْفِرَةٌ

phrase: Laughing, rejoicing.
translation: ضَاحِكَةٌ مُسْتَبْشِرَةٌ

phrase: And other faces that Day will be dust-stained,
translation: وَوُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ عَلَيْهَا غَبَرَةٌ

phrase: Blackness will cover them:
translation: تَرْهَقُهَا قَتَرَةٌ

phrase: Such will be the Rejecters of Allah, the doers of iniquity.
translation: أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْكَفَرَةُ الْفَجَرَةُ

phrase: When the sun (with its spacious light) is folded up;
translation: إِذَا الشَّمْسُ كُوِّرَتْ

phrase: When the stars fall, losing their lustre;
translation: وَإِذَا النُّجُومُ انْكَدَرَتْ

phrase: When the mountains vanish (like a mirage);
translation: وَإِذَا الْجِبَالُ سُيِّرَتْ

phrase: When the she-camels, ten months with young, are left untended;
translation: وَإِذَا الْعِشَارُ عُطِّلَتْ

phrase: When the wild beasts are herded together (in the human habitations);
translation: وَإِذَا الْوُحُوشُ حُشِرَتْ

phrase: When the oceans boil over with a swell;
translation: وَإِذَا الْبِحَارُ سُجِّرَتْ

phrase: When the souls are sorted out, (being joined, like with like);
translation: وَإِذَا النُّفُوسُ زُوِّجَتْ

phrase: When the female (infant), buried alive, is questioned -
translation: وَإِذَا الْمَوْءُودَةُ سُئِلَتْ

phrase: For what crime she was killed;
translation: بِأَيِّ ذَنْبٍ قُتِلَتْ

phrase: When the scrolls are laid open;
translation: وَإِذَا الصُّحُفُ نُشِرَتْ

phrase: When the world on High is unveiled;
translation: وَإِذَا السَّمَاءُ كُشِطَتْ

phrase: When the Blazing Fire is kindled to fierce heat;
translation: وَإِذَا الْجَحِيمُ سُعِّرَتْ

phrase: And when the Garden is brought near;-
translation: وَإِذَا الْجَنَّةُ أُزْلِفَتْ

phrase: (Then) shall each soul know what it has put forward.
translation: عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَا أَحْضَرَتْ

phrase: So verily I call to witness the planets - that recede,
translation: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِالْخُنَّسِ

phrase: Go straight, or hide;
translation: الْجَوَارِ الْكُنَّسِ

phrase: And the Night as it dissipates;
translation: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا عَسْعَسَ

phrase: And the Dawn as it breathes away the darkness;-
translation: وَالصُّبْحِ إِذَا تَنَفَّسَ

phrase: Verily this is the word of a most honourable Messenger,
translation: إِنَّهُ لَقَوْلُ رَسُولٍ كَرِيمٍ

phrase: Endued with Power, with rank before the Lord of the Throne,
translation: ذِي قُوَّةٍ عِنْدَ ذِي الْعَرْشِ مَكِينٍ

phrase: With authority there, (and) faithful to his trust.
translation: مُطَاعٍ ثَمَّ أَمِينٍ

phrase: And (O people!) your companion is not one possessed;
translation: وَمَا صَاحِبُكُمْ بِمَجْنُونٍ

phrase: And without doubt he saw him in the clear horizon.
translation: وَلَقَدْ رَآهُ بِالْأُفُقِ الْمُبِينِ

phrase: Neither doth he withhold grudgingly a knowledge of the Unseen.
translation: وَمَا هُوَ عَلَى الْغَيْبِ بِضَنِينٍ

phrase: Nor is it the word of an evil spirit accursed.
translation: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَيْطَانٍ رَجِيمٍ

phrase: When whither go ye?
translation: فَأَيْنَ تَذْهَبُونَ

phrase: Verily this is no less than a Message to (all) the Worlds:
translation: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِلْعَالَمِينَ

phrase: (With profit) to whoever among you wills to go straight:
translation: لِمَنْ شَاءَ مِنْكُمْ أَنْ يَسْتَقِيمَ

phrase: But ye shall not will except as Allah wills,- the Cherisher of the Worlds.
translation: وَمَا تَشَاءُونَ إِلَّا أَنْ يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ رَبُّ الْعَالَمِينَ

phrase: When the Sky is cleft asunder;
translation: إِذَا السَّمَاءُ انْفَطَرَتْ

phrase: When the Stars are scattered;
translation: وَإِذَا الْكَوَاكِبُ انْتَثَرَتْ

phrase: When the Oceans are suffered to burst forth;
translation: وَإِذَا الْبِحَارُ فُجِّرَتْ

phrase: And when the Graves are turned upside down;-
translation: وَإِذَا الْقُبُورُ بُعْثِرَتْ

phrase: (Then) shall each soul know what it hath sent forward and (what it hath) kept back.
translation: عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَا قَدَّمَتْ وَأَخَّرَتْ

phrase: O man! What has seduced thee from thy Lord Most Beneficent?-
translation: يَا أَيُّهَا الْإِنْسَانُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ الْكَرِيمِ

phrase: Him Who created thee. Fashioned thee in due proportion, and gave thee a just bias;
translation: الَّذِي خَلَقَكَ فَسَوَّاكَ فَعَدَلَكَ

phrase: In whatever Form He wills, does He put thee together.
translation: فِي أَيِّ صُورَةٍ مَا شَاءَ رَكَّبَكَ

phrase: Nay! But ye do reject Right and Judgment!
translation: كَلَّا بَلْ تُكَذِّبُونَ بِالدِّينِ

phrase: But verily over you (are appointed angels) to protect you,-
translation: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكُمْ لَحَافِظِينَ

phrase: Kind and honourable,- Writing down (your deeds):
translation: كِرَامًا كَاتِبِينَ

phrase: They know (and understand) all that ye do.
translation: يَعْلَمُونَ مَا تَفْعَلُونَ

phrase: As for the Righteous, they will be in bliss;
translation: إِنَّ الْأَبْرَارَ لَفِي نَعِيمٍ

phrase: And the Wicked - they will be in the Fire,
translation: وَإِنَّ الْفُجَّارَ لَفِي جَحِيمٍ

phrase: Which they will enter on the Day of Judgment,
translation: يَصْلَوْنَهَا يَوْمَ الدِّينِ

phrase: And they will not be able to keep away therefrom.
translation: وَمَا هُمْ عَنْهَا بِغَائِبِينَ

phrase: And what will explain to thee what the Day of Judgment is?
translation: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا يَوْمُ الدِّينِ

phrase: Again, what will explain to thee what the Day of Judgment is?
translation: ثُمَّ مَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا يَوْمُ الدِّينِ

phrase: (It will be) the Day when no soul shall have power (to do) aught for another: For the command, that Day, will be (wholly) with Allah.
translation: يَوْمَ لَا تَمْلِكُ نَفْسٌ لِنَفْسٍ شَيْئًا ۖ وَالْأَمْرُ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلَّهِ

phrase: Woe to those that deal in fraud,-
translation: وَيْلٌ لِلْمُطَفِّفِينَ

phrase: Those who, when they have to receive by measure from men, exact full measure,
translation: الَّذِينَ إِذَا اكْتَالُوا عَلَى النَّاسِ يَسْتَوْفُونَ

phrase: But when they have to give by measure or weight to men, give less than due.
translation: وَإِذَا كَالُوهُمْ أَوْ وَزَنُوهُمْ يُخْسِرُونَ

phrase: Do they not think that they will be called to account?-
translation: أَلَا يَظُنُّ أُولَٰئِكَ أَنَّهُمْ مَبْعُوثُونَ

phrase: On a Mighty Day,
translation: لِيَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ

phrase: A Day when (all) mankind will stand before the Lord of the Worlds?
translation: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ النَّاسُ لِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

phrase: Nay! Surely the record of the wicked is (preserved) in Sijjin.
translation: كَلَّا إِنَّ كِتَابَ الْفُجَّارِ لَفِي سِجِّينٍ

phrase: And what will explain to thee what Sijjin is?
translation: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا سِجِّينٌ

phrase: (There is) a Register (fully) inscribed.
translation: كِتَابٌ مَرْقُومٌ

phrase: Woe, that Day, to those that deny-
translation: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ

phrase: Those that deny the Day of Judgment.
translation: الَّذِينَ يُكَذِّبُونَ بِيَوْمِ الدِّينِ

phrase: And none can deny it but the Transgressor beyond bounds the Sinner!
translation: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ

phrase: When Our Signs are rehearsed to him, he says, "Tales of the ancients!"
translation: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ آيَاتُنَا قَالَ أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ

phrase: By no means! but on their hearts is the stain of the (ill) which they do!
translation: كَلَّا ۖ بَلْ ۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ مَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ

phrase: Verily, from (the Light of) their Lord, that Day, will they be veiled.
translation: كَلَّا إِنَّهُمْ عَنْ رَبِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَمَحْجُوبُونَ

phrase: Further, they will enter the Fire of Hell.
translation: ثُمَّ إِنَّهُمْ لَصَالُو الْجَحِيمِ

phrase: Further, it will be said to them: "This is the (reality) which ye rejected as false!
translation: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ

phrase: Day, verily the record of the Righteous is (preserved) in ´Illiyin.
translation: كَلَّا إِنَّ كِتَابَ الْأَبْرَارِ لَفِي عِلِّيِّينَ

phrase: And what will explain to thee what ´Illiyun is?
translation: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا عِلِّيُّونَ

phrase: To which bear witness those Nearest (to Allah).
translation: يَشْهَدُهُ الْمُقَرَّبُونَ

phrase: On Thrones (of Dignity) will they command a sight (of all things):
translation: عَلَى الْأَرَائِكِ يَنْظُرُونَ

phrase: Thou wilt recognise in their faces the beaming brightness of Bliss.
translation: تَعْرِفُ فِي وُجُوهِهِمْ نَضْرَةَ النَّعِيمِ

phrase: Their thirst will be slaked with Pure Wine sealed:
translation: يُسْقَوْنَ مِنْ رَحِيقٍ مَخْتُومٍ

phrase: The seal thereof will be Musk: And for this let those aspire, who have aspirations:
translation: خِتَامُهُ مِسْكٌ ۚ وَفِي ذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَتَنَافَسِ الْمُتَنَافِسُونَ

phrase: With it will be (given) a mixture of Tasnim:
translation: وَمِزَاجُهُ مِنْ تَسْنِيمٍ

phrase: A spring, from (the waters) whereof drink those Nearest to Allah.
translation: عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا الْمُقَرَّبُونَ

phrase: Those in sin used to laugh at those who believed,
translation: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا كَانُوا مِنَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا يَضْحَكُونَ

phrase: And whenever they passed by them, used to wink at each other (in mockery);
translation: وَإِذَا مَرُّوا بِهِمْ يَتَغَامَزُونَ

phrase: And when they returned to their own people, they would return jesting;
translation: وَإِذَا انْقَلَبُوا إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِمُ انْقَلَبُوا فَكِهِينَ

phrase: And whenever they saw them, they would say, "Behold! These are the people truly astray!"
translation: وَإِذَا رَأَوْهُمْ قَالُوا إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ لَضَالُّونَ

phrase: But they had not been sent as keepers over them!
translation: وَمَا أُرْسِلُوا عَلَيْهِمْ حَافِظِينَ

phrase: But on this Day the Believers will laugh at the Unbelievers:
translation: فَالْيَوْمَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مِنَ الْكُفَّارِ يَضْحَكُونَ

phrase: Will not the Unbelievers have been paid back for what they did?
translation: هَلْ ثُوِّبَ الْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا يَفْعَلُونَ

phrase: When the sky is rent asunder,
translation: إِذَا السَّمَاءُ انْشَقَّتْ

phrase: And hearkens to (the Command of) its Lord, and it must needs (do so);-
translation: وَأَذِنَتْ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتْ

phrase: And when the earth is flattened out,
translation: وَإِذَا الْأَرْضُ مُدَّتْ

phrase: And casts forth what is within it and becomes (clean) empty,
translation: وَأَلْقَتْ مَا فِيهَا وَتَخَلَّتْ

phrase: O thou man! Verily thou art ever toiling on towards thy Lord- painfully toiling,- but thou shalt meet Him.
translation: يَا أَيُّهَا الْإِنْسَانُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدْحًا فَمُلَاقِيهِ

phrase: Then he who is given his Record in his right hand,
translation: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِيَمِينِهِ

phrase: Soon will his account be taken by an easy reckoning,
translation: فَسَوْفَ يُحَاسَبُ حِسَابًا يَسِيرًا

phrase: And he will turn to his people, rejoicing!
translation: وَيَنْقَلِبُ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ مَسْرُورًا

phrase: But he who is given his Record behind his back,-
translation: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ وَرَاءَ ظَهْرِهِ

phrase: Soon will he cry for perdition,
translation: فَسَوْفَ يَدْعُو ثُبُورًا

phrase: And he will enter a Blazing Fire.
translation: وَيَصْلَىٰ سَعِيرًا

phrase: Truly, did he go about among his people, rejoicing!
translation: إِنَّهُ كَانَ فِي أَهْلِهِ مَسْرُورًا

phrase: Truly, did he think that he would not have to return (to Us)!
translation: إِنَّهُ ظَنَّ أَنْ لَنْ يَحُورَ

phrase: Nay, nay! for his Lord was (ever) watchful of him!
translation: بَلَىٰ إِنَّ رَبَّهُ كَانَ بِهِ بَصِيرًا

phrase: So I do call to witness the ruddy glow of Sunset;
translation: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِالشَّفَقِ

phrase: The Night and its Homing;
translation: وَاللَّيْلِ وَمَا وَسَقَ

phrase: And the Moon in her fullness:
translation: وَالْقَمَرِ إِذَا اتَّسَقَ

phrase: Ye shall surely travel from stage to stage.
translation: لَتَرْكَبُنَّ طَبَقًا عَنْ طَبَقٍ

phrase: What then is the matter with them, that they believe not?-
translation: فَمَا لَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ

phrase: And when the Qur´an is read to them, they fall not prostrate,
translation: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيْهِمُ الْقُرْآنُ لَا يَسْجُدُونَ ۩

phrase: But on the contrary the Unbelievers reject (it).
translation: بَلِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا يُكَذِّبُونَ

phrase: But Allah has full knowledge of what they secrete (in their breasts)
translation: وَاللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يُوعُونَ

phrase: So announce to them a Penalty Grievous,
translation: فَبَشِّرْهُمْ بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ

phrase: Except to those who believe and work righteous deeds: For them is a Reward that will never fail.
translation: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ

phrase: By the sky, (displaying) the Zodiacal Signs;
translation: وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الْبُرُوجِ

phrase: By the promised Day (of Judgment);
translation: وَالْيَوْمِ الْمَوْعُودِ

phrase: By one that witnesses, and the subject of the witness;-
translation: وَشَاهِدٍ وَمَشْهُودٍ

phrase: Woe to the makers of the pit (of fire),
translation: قُتِلَ أَصْحَابُ الْأُخْدُودِ

phrase: Fire supplied (abundantly) with fuel:
translation: النَّارِ ذَاتِ الْوَقُودِ

phrase: Behold! they sat over against the (fire),
translation: إِذْ هُمْ عَلَيْهَا قُعُودٌ

phrase: And they witnessed (all) that they were doing against the Believers.
translation: وَهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفْعَلُونَ بِالْمُؤْمِنِينَ شُهُودٌ

phrase: And they ill-treated them for no other reason than that they believed in Allah, Exalted in Power, Worthy of all Praise!-
translation: وَمَا نَقَمُوا مِنْهُمْ إِلَّا أَنْ يُؤْمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَمِيدِ

phrase: Him to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth! And Allah is Witness to all things.
translation: الَّذِي لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ شَهِيدٌ

phrase: Those who persecute (or draw into temptation) the Believers, men and women, and do not turn in repentance, will have the Penalty of Hell: They will have the Penalty of the Burning Fire.
translation: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ فَتَنُوا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَتُوبُوا فَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ الْحَرِيقِ

phrase: For those who believe and do righteous deeds, will be Gardens; beneath which rivers flow: That is the great Salvation, (the fulfilment of all desires),
translation: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَهُمْ جَنَّاتٌ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الْفَوْزُ الْكَبِيرُ

phrase: Truly strong is the Grip (and Power) of thy Lord.
translation: إِنَّ بَطْشَ رَبِّكَ لَشَدِيدٌ

phrase: It is He Who creates from the very beginning, and He can restore (life).
translation: إِنَّهُ هُوَ يُبْدِئُ وَيُعِيدُ

phrase: And He is the Oft-Forgiving, Full of Loving-Kindness,
translation: وَهُوَ الْغَفُورُ الْوَدُودُ

phrase: Lord of the Throne of Glory,
translation: ذُو الْعَرْشِ الْمَجِيدُ

phrase: Doer (without let) of all that He intends.
translation: فَعَّالٌ لِمَا يُرِيدُ

phrase: Has the story reached thee, of the forces-
translation: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ الْجُنُودِ

phrase: Of Pharaoh and the Thamud?
translation: فِرْعَوْنَ وَثَمُودَ

phrase: And yet the Unbelievers (persist) in rejecting (the Truth)!
translation: بَلِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فِي تَكْذِيبٍ

phrase: But Allah doth encompass them from behind!
translation: وَاللَّهُ مِنْ وَرَائِهِمْ مُحِيطٌ

phrase: Day, this is a Glorious Qur´an,
translation: بَلْ هُوَ قُرْآنٌ مَجِيدٌ

phrase: (Inscribed) in a Tablet Preserved!
translation: فِي لَوْحٍ مَحْفُوظٍ

phrase: By the Sky and the Night-Visitant (therein);-
translation: وَالسَّمَاءِ وَالطَّارِقِ

phrase: And what will explain to thee what the Night-Visitant is?-
translation: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الطَّارِقُ

phrase: (It is) the Star of piercing brightness;-
translation: النَّجْمُ الثَّاقِبُ

phrase: There is no soul but has a protector over it.
translation: إِنْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ لَمَّا عَلَيْهَا حَافِظٌ

phrase: Now let man but think from what he is created!
translation: فَلْيَنْظُرِ الْإِنْسَانُ مِمَّ خُلِقَ

phrase: He is created from a drop emitted-
translation: خُلِقَ مِنْ مَاءٍ دَافِقٍ

phrase: Proceeding from between the backbone and the ribs:
translation: يَخْرُجُ مِنْ بَيْنِ الصُّلْبِ وَالتَّرَائِبِ

phrase: Surely (Allah) is able to bring him back (to life)!
translation: إِنَّهُ عَلَىٰ رَجْعِهِ لَقَادِرٌ

phrase: The Day that (all) things secret will be tested,
translation: يَوْمَ تُبْلَى السَّرَائِرُ

phrase: (Man) will have no power, and no helper.
translation: فَمَا لَهُ مِنْ قُوَّةٍ وَلَا نَاصِرٍ

phrase: By the Firmament which returns (in its round),
translation: وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الرَّجْعِ

phrase: And by the Earth which opens out (for the gushing of springs or the sprouting of vegetation),-
translation: وَالْأَرْضِ ذَاتِ الصَّدْعِ

phrase: Behold this is the Word that distinguishes (Good from Evil):
translation: إِنَّهُ لَقَوْلٌ فَصْلٌ

phrase: It is not a thing for amusement.
translation: وَمَا هُوَ بِالْهَزْلِ

phrase: As for them, they are but plotting a scheme,
translation: إِنَّهُمْ يَكِيدُونَ كَيْدًا

phrase: And I am planning a scheme.
translation: وَأَكِيدُ كَيْدًا

phrase: Therefore grant a delay to the Unbelievers: Give respite to them gently (for awhile).
translation: فَمَهِّلِ الْكَافِرِينَ أَمْهِلْهُمْ رُوَيْدًا

phrase: Glorify the name of thy Guardian-Lord Most High,
translation: سَبِّحِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ الْأَعْلَى

phrase: Who hath created, and further, given order and proportion;
translation: الَّذِي خَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ

phrase: Who hath ordained laws. And granted guidance;
translation: وَالَّذِي قَدَّرَ فَهَدَىٰ

phrase: And Who bringeth out the (green and luscious) pasture,
translation: وَالَّذِي أَخْرَجَ الْمَرْعَىٰ

phrase: And then doth make it (but) swarthy stubble.
translation: فَجَعَلَهُ غُثَاءً أَحْوَىٰ

phrase: By degrees shall We teach thee to declare (the Message), so thou shalt not forget,
translation: سَنُقْرِئُكَ فَلَا تَنْسَىٰ

phrase: Except as Allah wills: For He knoweth what is manifest and what is hidden.
translation: إِلَّا مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ يَعْلَمُ الْجَهْرَ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ

phrase: And We will make it easy for thee (to follow) the simple (Path).
translation: وَنُيَسِّرُكَ لِلْيُسْرَىٰ

phrase: Therefore give admonition in case the admonition profits (the hearer).
translation: فَذَكِّرْ إِنْ نَفَعَتِ الذِّكْرَىٰ

phrase: The admonition will be received by those who fear (Allah):
translation: سَيَذَّكَّرُ مَنْ يَخْشَىٰ

phrase: But it will be avoided by those most unfortunate ones,
translation: وَيَتَجَنَّبُهَا الْأَشْقَى

phrase: Who will enter the Great Fire,
translation: الَّذِي يَصْلَى النَّارَ الْكُبْرَىٰ

phrase: In which they will then neither die nor live.
translation: ثُمَّ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحْيَىٰ

phrase: But those will prosper who purify themselves,
translation: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَنْ تَزَكَّىٰ

phrase: And glorify the name of their Guardian-Lord, and (lift their hearts) in prayer.
translation: وَذَكَرَ اسْمَ رَبِّهِ فَصَلَّىٰ

phrase: Day (behold), ye prefer the life of this world;
translation: بَلْ تُؤْثِرُونَ الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا

phrase: But the Hereafter is better and more enduring.
translation: وَالْآخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰ

phrase: And this is in the Books of the earliest (Revelation),-
translation: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَفِي الصُّحُفِ الْأُولَىٰ

phrase: The Books of Abraham and Moses.
translation: صُحُفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَمُوسَىٰ

phrase: Has the story reached thee of the overwhelming (Event)?
translation: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ الْغَاشِيَةِ

phrase: Some faces, that Day, will be humiliated,
translation: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ خَاشِعَةٌ

phrase: Labouring (hard), weary,-
translation: عَامِلَةٌ نَاصِبَةٌ

phrase: The while they enter the Blazing Fire,-
translation: تَصْلَىٰ نَارًا حَامِيَةً

phrase: The while they are given, to drink, of a boiling hot spring,
translation: تُسْقَىٰ مِنْ عَيْنٍ آنِيَةٍ

phrase: No food will there be for them but a bitter Dhari´
translation: لَيْسَ لَهُمْ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِنْ ضَرِيعٍ

phrase: Which will neither nourish nor satisfy hunger.
translation: لَا يُسْمِنُ وَلَا يُغْنِي مِنْ جُوعٍ

phrase: (Other) faces that Day will be joyful,
translation: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ نَاعِمَةٌ

phrase: Pleased with their striving,-
translation: لِسَعْيِهَا رَاضِيَةٌ

phrase: In a Garden on high,
translation: فِي جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٍ

phrase: Where they shall hear no (word) of vanity:
translation: لَا تَسْمَعُ فِيهَا لَاغِيَةً

phrase: Therein will be a bubbling spring:
translation: فِيهَا عَيْنٌ جَارِيَةٌ

phrase: Therein will be Thrones (of dignity), raised on high,
translation: فِيهَا سُرُرٌ مَرْفُوعَةٌ

phrase: Goblets placed (ready),
translation: وَأَكْوَابٌ مَوْضُوعَةٌ

phrase: And cushions set in rows,
translation: وَنَمَارِقُ مَصْفُوفَةٌ

phrase: And rich carpets (all) spread out.
translation: وَزَرَابِيُّ مَبْثُوثَةٌ

phrase: Do they not look at the Camels, how they are made?-
translation: أَفَلَا يَنْظُرُونَ إِلَى الْإِبِلِ كَيْفَ خُلِقَتْ

phrase: And at the Sky, how it is raised high?-
translation: وَإِلَى السَّمَاءِ كَيْفَ رُفِعَتْ

phrase: And at the Mountains, how they are fixed firm?-
translation: وَإِلَى الْجِبَالِ كَيْفَ نُصِبَتْ

phrase: And at the Earth, how it is spread out?
translation: وَإِلَى الْأَرْضِ كَيْفَ سُطِحَتْ

phrase: Therefore do thou give admonition, for thou art one to admonish.
translation: فَذَكِّرْ إِنَّمَا أَنْتَ مُذَكِّرٌ

phrase: Thou art not one to manage (men´s) affairs.
translation: لَسْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ بِمُصَيْطِرٍ

phrase: But if any turn away and reject Allah,-
translation: إِلَّا مَنْ تَوَلَّىٰ وَكَفَرَ

phrase: Allah will punish him with a mighty Punishment,
translation: فَيُعَذِّبُهُ اللَّهُ الْعَذَابَ الْأَكْبَرَ

phrase: For to Us will be their return;
translation: إِنَّ إِلَيْنَا إِيَابَهُمْ

phrase: Then it will be for Us to call them to account.
translation: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا حِسَابَهُمْ

phrase: By the break of Day
translation: وَالْفَجْرِ

phrase: By the Nights twice five;
translation: وَلَيَالٍ عَشْرٍ

phrase: By the even and odd (contrasted);
translation: وَالشَّفْعِ وَالْوَتْرِ

phrase: And by the Night when it passeth away;-
translation: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَسْرِ

phrase: Is there (not) in these an adjuration (or evidence) for those who understand?
translation: هَلْ فِي ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِذِي حِجْرٍ

phrase: Seest thou not how thy Lord dealt with the ´Ad (people),-
translation: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ

phrase: Of the (city of) Iram, with lofty pillars,
translation: إِرَمَ ذَاتِ الْعِمَادِ

phrase: The like of which were not produced in (all) the land?
translation: الَّتِي لَمْ يُخْلَقْ مِثْلُهَا فِي الْبِلَادِ

phrase: And with the Thamud (people), who cut out (huge) rocks in the valley?-
translation: وَثَمُودَ الَّذِينَ جَابُوا الصَّخْرَ بِالْوَادِ

phrase: And with Pharaoh, lord of stakes?
translation: وَفِرْعَوْنَ ذِي الْأَوْتَادِ

phrase: (All) these transgressed beyond bounds in the lands,
translation: الَّذِينَ طَغَوْا فِي الْبِلَادِ

phrase: And heaped therein mischief (on mischief).
translation: فَأَكْثَرُوا فِيهَا الْفَسَادَ

phrase: Therefore did thy Lord pour on them a scourge of diverse chastisements:
translation: فَصَبَّ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّكَ سَوْطَ عَذَابٍ

phrase: For thy Lord is (as a Guardian) on a watch-tower.
translation: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَبِالْمِرْصَادِ

phrase: Now, as for man, when his Lord trieth him, giving him honour and gifts, then saith he, (puffed up), "My Lord hath honoured me."
translation: فَأَمَّا الْإِنْسَانُ إِذَا مَا ابْتَلَاهُ رَبُّهُ فَأَكْرَمَهُ وَنَعَّمَهُ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّي أَكْرَمَنِ

phrase: But when He trieth him, restricting his subsistence for him, then saith he (in despair), "My Lord hath humiliated me!"
translation: وَأَمَّا إِذَا مَا ابْتَلَاهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقَهُ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّي أَهَانَنِ

phrase: Nay, nay! but ye honour not the orphans!
translation: كَلَّا ۖ بَلْ لَا تُكْرِمُونَ الْيَتِيمَ

phrase: Nor do ye encourage one another to feed the poor!-
translation: وَلَا تَحَاضُّونَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ الْمِسْكِينِ

phrase: And ye devour inheritance - all with greed,
translation: وَتَأْكُلُونَ التُّرَاثَ أَكْلًا لَمًّا

phrase: And ye love wealth with inordinate love!
translation: وَتُحِبُّونَ الْمَالَ حُبًّا جَمًّا

phrase: Nay! When the earth is pounded to powder,
translation: كَلَّا إِذَا دُكَّتِ الْأَرْضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا

phrase: And thy Lord cometh, and His angels, rank upon rank,
translation: وَجَاءَ رَبُّكَ وَالْمَلَكُ صَفًّا صَفًّا

phrase: And Hell, that Day, is brought (face to face),- on that Day will man remember, but how will that remembrance profit him?
translation: وَجِيءَ يَوْمَئِذٍ بِجَهَنَّمَ ۚ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ الْإِنْسَانُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ الذِّكْرَىٰ

phrase: He will say: "Ah! Would that I had sent forth (good deeds) for (this) my (Future) Life!"
translation: يَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي قَدَّمْتُ لِحَيَاتِي

phrase: For, that Day, His Chastisement will be such as none (else) can inflict,
translation: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَا يُعَذِّبُ عَذَابَهُ أَحَدٌ

phrase: And His bonds will be such as none (other) can bind.
translation: وَلَا يُوثِقُ وَثَاقَهُ أَحَدٌ

phrase: (To the righteous soul will be said:) "O (thou) soul, in (complete) rest and satisfaction!
translation: يَا أَيَّتُهَا النَّفْسُ الْمُطْمَئِنَّةُ

phrase: "Come back thou to thy Lord,- well pleased (thyself), and well-pleasing unto Him!
translation: ارْجِعِي إِلَىٰ رَبِّكِ رَاضِيَةً مَرْضِيَّةً

phrase: "Enter thou, then, among My devotees!
translation: فَادْخُلِي فِي عِبَادِي

phrase: "Yea, enter thou My Heaven!
translation: وَادْخُلِي جَنَّتِي

phrase: I do call to witness this City;-
translation: لَا أُقْسِمُ بِهَٰذَا الْبَلَدِ

phrase: And thou art a freeman of this City;-
translation: وَأَنْتَ حِلٌّ بِهَٰذَا الْبَلَدِ

phrase: And (the mystic ties of) parent and child;-
translation: وَوَالِدٍ وَمَا وَلَدَ

phrase: Verily We have created man into toil and struggle.
translation: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ فِي كَبَدٍ

phrase: Thinketh he, that none hath power over him?
translation: أَيَحْسَبُ أَنْ لَنْ يَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ أَحَدٌ

phrase: He may say (boastfully); Wealth have I squandered in abundance!
translation: يَقُولُ أَهْلَكْتُ مَالًا لُبَدًا

phrase: Thinketh he that none beholdeth him?
translation: أَيَحْسَبُ أَنْ لَمْ يَرَهُ أَحَدٌ

phrase: Have We not made for him a pair of eyes?-
translation: أَلَمْ نَجْعَلْ لَهُ عَيْنَيْنِ

phrase: And a tongue, and a pair of lips?-
translation: وَلِسَانًا وَشَفَتَيْنِ

phrase: And shown him the two highways?
translation: وَهَدَيْنَاهُ النَّجْدَيْنِ

phrase: But he hath made no haste on the path that is steep.
translation: فَلَا اقْتَحَمَ الْعَقَبَةَ

phrase: And what will explain to thee the path that is steep?-
translation: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الْعَقَبَةُ

phrase: (It is:) freeing the bondman;
translation: فَكُّ رَقَبَةٍ

phrase: Or the giving of food in a day of privation
translation: أَوْ إِطْعَامٌ فِي يَوْمٍ ذِي مَسْغَبَةٍ

phrase: To the orphan with claims of relationship,
translation: يَتِيمًا ذَا مَقْرَبَةٍ

phrase: Or to the indigent (down) in the dust.
translation: أَوْ مِسْكِينًا ذَا مَتْرَبَةٍ

phrase: Then will he be of those who believe, and enjoin patience, (constancy, and self-restraint), and enjoin deeds of kindness and compassion.
translation: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالصَّبْرِ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالْمَرْحَمَةِ

phrase: Such are the Companions of the Right Hand.
translation: أُولَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ الْمَيْمَنَةِ

phrase: But those who reject Our Signs, they are the (unhappy) Companions of the Left Hand.
translation: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِآيَاتِنَا هُمْ أَصْحَابُ الْمَشْأَمَةِ

phrase: On them will be Fire vaulted over (all round).
translation: عَلَيْهِمْ نَارٌ مُؤْصَدَةٌ

phrase: By the Sun and his (glorious) splendour;
translation: وَالشَّمْسِ وَضُحَاهَا

phrase: By the Moon as she follows him;
translation: وَالْقَمَرِ إِذَا تَلَاهَا

phrase: By the Day as it shows up (the Sun´s) glory;
translation: وَالنَّهَارِ إِذَا جَلَّاهَا

phrase: By the Night as it conceals it;
translation: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَاهَا

phrase: By the Firmament and its (wonderful) structure;
translation: وَالسَّمَاءِ وَمَا بَنَاهَا

phrase: By the Earth and its (wide) expanse:
translation: وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا طَحَاهَا

phrase: By the Soul, and the proportion and order given to it;
translation: وَنَفْسٍ وَمَا سَوَّاهَا

phrase: And its enlightenment as to its wrong and its right;-
translation: فَأَلْهَمَهَا فُجُورَهَا وَتَقْوَاهَا

phrase: Truly he succeeds that purifies it,
translation: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَنْ زَكَّاهَا

phrase: And he fails that corrupts it!
translation: وَقَدْ خَابَ مَنْ دَسَّاهَا

phrase: The Thamud (people) rejected (their prophet) through their inordinate wrong-doing,
translation: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِطَغْوَاهَا

phrase: Behold, the most wicked man among them was deputed (for impiety).
translation: إِذِ انْبَعَثَ أَشْقَاهَا

phrase: But the Messenger of Allah said to them: "It is a She-camel of Allah! And (bar her not from) having her drink!"
translation: فَقَالَ لَهُمْ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ نَاقَةَ اللَّهِ وَسُقْيَاهَا

phrase: Then they rejected him (as a false prophet), and they hamstrung her. So their Lord, on account of their crime, obliterated their traces and made them equal (in destruction, high and low)!
translation: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمْدَمَ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ بِذَنْبِهِمْ فَسَوَّاهَا

phrase: And for Him is no fear of its consequences.
translation: وَلَا يَخَافُ عُقْبَاهَا

phrase: By the Night as it conceals (the light);
translation: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَىٰ

phrase: By the Day as it appears in glory;
translation: وَالنَّهَارِ إِذَا تَجَلَّىٰ

phrase: By (the mystery of) the creation of male and female;-
translation: وَمَا خَلَقَ الذَّكَرَ وَالْأُنْثَىٰ

phrase: Verily, (the ends) ye strive for are diverse.
translation: إِنَّ سَعْيَكُمْ لَشَتَّىٰ

phrase: So he who gives (in charity) and fears (Allah),
translation: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أَعْطَىٰ وَاتَّقَىٰ

phrase: And (in all sincerity) testifies to the best,-
translation: وَصَدَّقَ بِالْحُسْنَىٰ

phrase: We will indeed make smooth for him the path to Bliss.
translation: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُ لِلْيُسْرَىٰ

phrase: But he who is a greedy miser and thinks himself self-sufficient,
translation: وَأَمَّا مَنْ بَخِلَ وَاسْتَغْنَىٰ

phrase: And gives the lie to the best,-
translation: وَكَذَّبَ بِالْحُسْنَىٰ

phrase: We will indeed make smooth for him the path to Misery;
translation: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُ لِلْعُسْرَىٰ

phrase: Nor will his wealth profit him when he falls headlong (into the Pit).
translation: وَمَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُ مَالُهُ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰ

phrase: Verily We take upon Ourselves to guide,
translation: إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا لَلْهُدَىٰ

phrase: And verily unto Us (belong) the End and the Beginning.
translation: وَإِنَّ لَنَا لَلْآخِرَةَ وَالْأُولَىٰ

phrase: Therefore do I warn you of a Fire blazing fiercely;
translation: فَأَنْذَرْتُكُمْ نَارًا تَلَظَّىٰ

phrase: None shall reach it but those most unfortunate ones
translation: لَا يَصْلَاهَا إِلَّا الْأَشْقَى

phrase: Who give the lie to Truth and turn their backs.
translation: الَّذِي كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ

phrase: But those most devoted to Allah shall be removed far from it,-
translation: وَسَيُجَنَّبُهَا الْأَتْقَى

phrase: Those who spend their wealth for increase in self-purification,
translation: الَّذِي يُؤْتِي مَالَهُ يَتَزَكَّىٰ

phrase: And have in their minds no favour from anyone for which a reward is expected in return,
translation: وَمَا لِأَحَدٍ عِنْدَهُ مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ تُجْزَىٰ

phrase: But only the desire to seek for the Countenance of their Lord Most High;
translation: إِلَّا ابْتِغَاءَ وَجْهِ رَبِّهِ الْأَعْلَىٰ

phrase: And soon will they attain (complete) satisfaction.
translation: وَلَسَوْفَ يَرْضَىٰ

phrase: Blessed be He in Whose hands is Dominion; and He over all things hath Power;-
translation: تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي بِيَدِهِ الْمُلْكُ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ

phrase: He Who created Death and Life, that He may try which of you is best in deed: and He is the Exalted in Might, Oft-Forgiving;-
translation: الَّذِي خَلَقَ الْمَوْتَ وَالْحَيَاةَ لِيَبْلُوَكُمْ أَيُّكُمْ أَحْسَنُ عَمَلًا ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْغَفُورُ

phrase: He Who created the seven heavens one above another: No want of proportion wilt thou see in the Creation of (Allah) Most Gracious. So turn thy vision again: seest thou any flaw?
translation: الَّذِي خَلَقَ سَبْعَ سَمَاوَاتٍ طِبَاقًا ۖ مَا تَرَىٰ فِي خَلْقِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ مِنْ تَفَاوُتٍ ۖ فَارْجِعِ الْبَصَرَ هَلْ تَرَىٰ مِنْ فُطُورٍ

phrase: Again turn thy vision a second time: (thy) vision will come back to thee dull and discomfited, in a state worn out.
translation: ثُمَّ ارْجِعِ الْبَصَرَ كَرَّتَيْنِ يَنْقَلِبْ إِلَيْكَ الْبَصَرُ خَاسِئًا وَهُوَ حَسِيرٌ

phrase: And we have, (from of old), adorned the lowest heaven with Lamps, and We have made such (Lamps) (as) missiles to drive away the Evil Ones, and have prepared for them the Penalty of the Blazing Fire.
translation: وَلَقَدْ زَيَّنَّا السَّمَاءَ الدُّنْيَا بِمَصَابِيحَ وَجَعَلْنَاهَا رُجُومًا لِلشَّيَاطِينِ ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لَهُمْ عَذَابَ السَّعِيرِ

phrase: For those who reject their Lord (and Cherisher) is the Penalty of Hell: and evil is (such), Destination.
translation: وَلِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِرَبِّهِمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ وَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ

phrase: When they are cast therein, they will hear the (terrible) drawing in of its breath even as it blazes forth,
translation: إِذَا أُلْقُوا فِيهَا سَمِعُوا لَهَا شَهِيقًا وَهِيَ تَفُورُ

phrase: Almost bursting with fury: Every time a Group is cast therein, its Keepers will ask, "Did no Warner come to you?"
translation: تَكَادُ تَمَيَّزُ مِنَ الْغَيْظِ ۖ كُلَّمَا أُلْقِيَ فِيهَا فَوْجٌ سَأَلَهُمْ خَزَنَتُهَا أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ نَذِيرٌ

phrase: They will say: "Yes indeed; a Warner did come to us, but we rejected him and said, ´Allah never sent down any (Message): ye are nothing but an egregious delusion!´"
translation: قَالُوا بَلَىٰ قَدْ جَاءَنَا نَذِيرٌ فَكَذَّبْنَا وَقُلْنَا مَا نَزَّلَ اللَّهُ مِنْ شَيْءٍ إِنْ أَنْتُمْ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَالٍ كَبِيرٍ

phrase: They will further say: "Had we but listened or used our intelligence, we should not (now) be among the Companions of the Blazing Fire!"
translation: وَقَالُوا لَوْ كُنَّا نَسْمَعُ أَوْ نَعْقِلُ مَا كُنَّا فِي أَصْحَابِ السَّعِيرِ

phrase: They will then confess their sins: but far will be (Forgiveness) from the Companions of the Blazing Fire!
translation: فَاعْتَرَفُوا بِذَنْبِهِمْ فَسُحْقًا لِأَصْحَابِ السَّعِيرِ

phrase: As for those who fear their Lord unseen, for them is Forgiveness and a great Reward.
translation: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُمْ بِالْغَيْبِ لَهُمْ مَغْفِرَةٌ وَأَجْرٌ كَبِيرٌ

phrase: And whether ye hide your word or publish it, He certainly has (full) knowledge, of the secrets of (all) hearts.
translation: وَأَسِرُّوا قَوْلَكُمْ أَوِ اجْهَرُوا بِهِ ۖ إِنَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ

phrase: Should He not know,- He that created? and He is the One that understands the finest mysteries (and) is well-acquainted (with them).
translation: أَلَا يَعْلَمُ مَنْ خَلَقَ وَهُوَ اللَّطِيفُ الْخَبِيرُ

phrase: It is He Who has made the earth manageable for you, so traverse ye through its tracts and enjoy of the Sustenance which He furnishes: but unto Him is the Resurrection.
translation: هُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ ذَلُولًا فَامْشُوا فِي مَنَاكِبِهَا وَكُلُوا مِنْ رِزْقِهِ ۖ وَإِلَيْهِ النُّشُورُ

phrase: Do ye feel secure that He Who is in heaven will not cause you to be swallowed up by the earth when it shakes (as in an earthquake)?
translation: أَأَمِنْتُمْ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاءِ أَنْ يَخْسِفَ بِكُمُ الْأَرْضَ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَمُورُ

phrase: Or do ye feel secure that He Who is in Heaven will not send against you a violent tornado (with showers of stones), so that ye shall know how (terrible) was My warning?
translation: أَمْ أَمِنْتُمْ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاءِ أَنْ يُرْسِلَ عَلَيْكُمْ حَاصِبًا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ كَيْفَ نَذِيرِ

phrase: But indeed men before them rejected (My warning): then how (terrible) was My rejection (of them)?
translation: وَلَقَدْ كَذَّبَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ

phrase: Do they not observe the birds above them, spreading their wings and folding them in? None can uphold them except (Allah) Most Gracious: Truly (Allah) Most Gracious: Truly it is He that watches over all things.
translation: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا إِلَى الطَّيْرِ فَوْقَهُمْ صَافَّاتٍ وَيَقْبِضْنَ ۚ مَا يُمْسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا الرَّحْمَٰنُ ۚ إِنَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ بَصِيرٌ

phrase: Nay, who is there that can help you, (even as) an army, besides (Allah) Most Merciful? In nothing but delusion are the Unbelievers.
translation: أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي هُوَ جُنْدٌ لَكُمْ يَنْصُرُكُمْ مِنْ دُونِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ ۚ إِنِ الْكَافِرُونَ إِلَّا فِي غُرُورٍ

phrase: Or who is there that can provide you with Sustenance if He were to withhold His provision? Nay, they obstinately persist in insolent impiety and flight (from the Truth).
translation: أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي يَرْزُقُكُمْ إِنْ أَمْسَكَ رِزْقَهُ ۚ بَلْ لَجُّوا فِي عُتُوٍّ وَنُفُورٍ

phrase: Is then one who walks headlong, with his face grovelling, better guided,- or one who walks evenly on a Straight Way?
translation: أَفَمَنْ يَمْشِي مُكِبًّا عَلَىٰ وَجْهِهِ أَهْدَىٰ أَمَّنْ يَمْشِي سَوِيًّا عَلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ

phrase: Say: "It is He Who has created you (and made you grow), and made for you the faculties of hearing, seeing, feeling and understanding: little thanks it is ye give.
translation: قُلْ هُوَ الَّذِي أَنْشَأَكُمْ وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ السَّمْعَ وَالْأَبْصَارَ وَالْأَفْئِدَةَ ۖ قَلِيلًا مَا تَشْكُرُونَ

phrase: Say: "It is He Who has multiplied you through the earth, and to Him shall ye be gathered together."
translation: قُلْ هُوَ الَّذِي ذَرَأَكُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ

phrase: They ask: When will this promise be (fulfilled)? - If ye are telling the truth.
translation: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا الْوَعْدُ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ

phrase: Say: "As to the knowledge of the time, it is with Allah alone: I am (sent) only to warn plainly in public."
translation: قُلْ إِنَّمَا الْعِلْمُ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ وَإِنَّمَا أَنَا نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ

phrase: At length, when they see it close at hand, grieved will be the faces of the Unbelievers, and it will be said (to them): "This is (the promise fulfilled), which ye were calling for!"
translation: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهُ زُلْفَةً سِيئَتْ وُجُوهُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَقِيلَ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تَدَّعُونَ

phrase: Say: "See ye?- If Allah were to destroy me, and those with me, or if He bestows His Mercy on us,- yet who can deliver the Unbelievers from a grievous Penalty?"
translation: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَهْلَكَنِيَ اللَّهُ وَمَنْ مَعِيَ أَوْ رَحِمَنَا فَمَنْ يُجِيرُ الْكَافِرِينَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ

phrase: Say: "He is (Allah) Most Gracious: We have believed in Him, and on Him have we put our trust: So, soon will ye know which (of us) it is that is in manifest error."
translation: قُلْ هُوَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ آمَنَّا بِهِ وَعَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ هُوَ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُبِينٍ

phrase: Say: "See ye?- If your stream be some morning lost (in the underground earth), who then can supply you with clear-flowing water?"
translation: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَصْبَحَ مَاؤُكُمْ غَوْرًا فَمَنْ يَأْتِيكُمْ بِمَاءٍ مَعِينٍ

phrase: Ya Sin.
translation: يس

phrase: By the Qur´an, full of Wisdom,-
translation: وَالْقُرْآنِ الْحَكِيمِ

phrase: Thou art indeed one of the messengers,
translation: إِنَّكَ لَمِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ

phrase: On a Straight Way.
translation: عَلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ

phrase: It is a Revelation sent down by (Him), the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
translation: تَنْزِيلَ الْعَزِيزِ الرَّحِيمِ

phrase: In order that thou mayest admonish a people, whose fathers had received no admonition, and who therefore remain heedless (of the Signs of Allah).
translation: لِتُنْذِرَ قَوْمًا مَا أُنْذِرَ آبَاؤُهُمْ فَهُمْ غَافِلُونَ

phrase: The Word is proved true against the greater part of them: for they do not believe.
translation: لَقَدْ حَقَّ الْقَوْلُ عَلَىٰ أَكْثَرِهِمْ فَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ

phrase: We have put yokes round their necks right up to their chins, so that their heads are forced up (and they cannot see).
translation: إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا فِي أَعْنَاقِهِمْ أَغْلَالًا فَهِيَ إِلَى الْأَذْقَانِ فَهُمْ مُقْمَحُونَ

phrase: And We have put a bar in front of them and a bar behind them, and further, We have covered them up; so that they cannot see.
translation: وَجَعَلْنَا مِنْ بَيْنِ أَيْدِيهِمْ سَدًّا وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِمْ سَدًّا فَأَغْشَيْنَاهُمْ فَهُمْ لَا يُبْصِرُونَ

phrase: The same is it to them whether thou admonish them or thou do not admonish them: they will not believe.
translation: وَسَوَاءٌ عَلَيْهِمْ أَأَنْذَرْتَهُمْ أَمْ لَمْ تُنْذِرْهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ

phrase: Thou canst but admonish such a one as follows the Message and fears the (Lord) Most Gracious, unseen: give such a one, therefore, good tidings, of Forgiveness and a Reward most generous.
translation: إِنَّمَا تُنْذِرُ مَنِ اتَّبَعَ الذِّكْرَ وَخَشِيَ الرَّحْمَٰنَ بِالْغَيْبِ ۖ فَبَشِّرْهُ بِمَغْفِرَةٍ وَأَجْرٍ كَرِيمٍ

phrase: Verily We shall give life to the dead, and We record that which they send before and that which they leave behind, and of all things have We taken account in a clear Book (of evidence).
translation: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نُحْيِي الْمَوْتَىٰ وَنَكْتُبُ مَا قَدَّمُوا وَآثَارَهُمْ ۚ وَكُلَّ شَيْءٍ أَحْصَيْنَاهُ فِي إِمَامٍ مُبِينٍ

phrase: Set forth to them, by way of a parable, the (story of) the Companions of the City. Behold!, there came messengers to it.
translation: وَاضْرِبْ لَهُمْ مَثَلًا أَصْحَابَ الْقَرْيَةِ إِذْ جَاءَهَا الْمُرْسَلُونَ

phrase: When We (first) sent to them two messengers, they rejected them: But We strengthened them with a third: they said, "Truly, we have been sent on a mission to you."
translation: إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَيْهِمُ اثْنَيْنِ فَكَذَّبُوهُمَا فَعَزَّزْنَا بِثَالِثٍ فَقَالُوا إِنَّا إِلَيْكُمْ مُرْسَلُونَ

phrase: The (people) said: "Ye are only men like ourselves; and (Allah) Most Gracious sends no sort of revelation: ye do nothing but lie."
translation: قَالُوا مَا أَنْتُمْ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُنَا وَمَا أَنْزَلَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ مِنْ شَيْءٍ إِنْ أَنْتُمْ إِلَّا تَكْذِبُونَ

phrase: They said: "Our Lord doth know that we have been sent on a mission to you:
translation: قَالُوا رَبُّنَا يَعْلَمُ إِنَّا إِلَيْكُمْ لَمُرْسَلُونَ

phrase: "And our duty is only to proclaim the clear Message."
translation: وَمَا عَلَيْنَا إِلَّا الْبَلَاغُ الْمُبِينُ

phrase: The (people) said: "for us, we augur an evil omen from you: if ye desist not, we will certainly stone you. And a grievous punishment indeed will be inflicted on you by us."
translation: قَالُوا إِنَّا تَطَيَّرْنَا بِكُمْ ۖ لَئِنْ لَمْ تَنْتَهُوا لَنَرْجُمَنَّكُمْ وَلَيَمَسَّنَّكُمْ مِنَّا عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ

phrase: They said: "Your evil omens are with yourselves: (deem ye this an evil omen). If ye are admonished? Nay, but ye are a people transgressing all bounds!"
translation: قَالُوا طَائِرُكُمْ مَعَكُمْ ۚ أَئِنْ ذُكِّرْتُمْ ۚ بَلْ أَنْتُمْ قَوْمٌ مُسْرِفُونَ

phrase: Then there came running, from the farthest part of the City, a man, saying, "O my people! Obey the messengers:
translation: وَجَاءَ مِنْ أَقْصَى الْمَدِينَةِ رَجُلٌ يَسْعَىٰ قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ اتَّبِعُوا الْمُرْسَلِينَ

phrase: "Obey those who ask no reward of you (for themselves), and who have themselves received Guidance.
translation: اتَّبِعُوا مَنْ لَا يَسْأَلُكُمْ أَجْرًا وَهُمْ مُهْتَدُونَ

phrase: "It would not be reasonable in me if I did not serve Him Who created me, and to Whom ye shall (all) be brought back.
translation: وَمَا لِيَ لَا أَعْبُدُ الَّذِي فَطَرَنِي وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ

phrase: "Shall I take (other) gods besides Him? If (Allah) Most Gracious should intend some adversity for me, of no use whatever will be their intercession for me, nor can they deliver me.
translation: أَأَتَّخِذُ مِنْ دُونِهِ آلِهَةً إِنْ يُرِدْنِ الرَّحْمَٰنُ بِضُرٍّ لَا تُغْنِ عَنِّي شَفَاعَتُهُمْ شَيْئًا وَلَا يُنْقِذُونِ

phrase: "I would indeed, if I were to do so, be in manifest Error.
translation: إِنِّي إِذًا لَفِي ضَلَالٍ مُبِينٍ

phrase: "For me, I have faith in the Lord of you (all): listen, then, to me!"
translation: إِنِّي آمَنْتُ بِرَبِّكُمْ فَاسْمَعُونِ

phrase: It was said: "Enter thou the Garden." He said: "Ah me! Would that my People knew (what I know)!-
translation: قِيلَ ادْخُلِ الْجَنَّةَ ۖ قَالَ يَا لَيْتَ قَوْمِي يَعْلَمُونَ

phrase: "For that my Lord has granted me Forgiveness and has enrolled me among those held in honour!"
translation: بِمَا غَفَرَ لِي رَبِّي وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ الْمُكْرَمِينَ

phrase: And We sent not down against his People, after him, any hosts from heaven, nor was it needful for Us so to do.
translation: وَمَا أَنْزَلْنَا عَلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ مِنْ بَعْدِهِ مِنْ جُنْدٍ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ وَمَا كُنَّا مُنْزِلِينَ

phrase: It was no more than a single mighty Blast, and behold! they were (like ashes) quenched and silent.
translation: إِنْ كَانَتْ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً فَإِذَا هُمْ خَامِدُونَ

phrase: Ah! Alas for (My) Servants! There comes not a messenger to them but they mock him!
translation: يَا حَسْرَةً عَلَى الْعِبَادِ ۚ مَا يَأْتِيهِمْ مِنْ رَسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ

phrase: See they not how many generations before them we destroyed? Not to them will they return:
translation: أَلَمْ يَرَوْا كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُمْ مِنَ الْقُرُونِ أَنَّهُمْ إِلَيْهِمْ لَا يَرْجِعُونَ

phrase: But each one of them all - will be brought before Us (for judgment).
translation: وَإِنْ كُلٌّ لَمَّا جَمِيعٌ لَدَيْنَا مُحْضَرُونَ

phrase: A Sign for them is the earth that is dead: We do give it life, and produce grain therefrom, of which ye do eat.
translation: وَآيَةٌ لَهُمُ الْأَرْضُ الْمَيْتَةُ أَحْيَيْنَاهَا وَأَخْرَجْنَا مِنْهَا حَبًّا فَمِنْهُ يَأْكُلُونَ

phrase: And We produce therein orchard with date-palms and vines, and We cause springs to gush forth therein:
translation: وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا جَنَّاتٍ مِنْ نَخِيلٍ وَأَعْنَابٍ وَفَجَّرْنَا فِيهَا مِنَ الْعُيُونِ

phrase: That they may enjoy the fruits of this (artistry): It was not their hands that made this: will they not then give thanks?
translation: لِيَأْكُلُوا مِنْ ثَمَرِهِ وَمَا عَمِلَتْهُ أَيْدِيهِمْ ۖ أَفَلَا يَشْكُرُونَ

phrase: Glory to Allah, Who created in pairs all things that the earth produces, as well as their own (human) kind and (other) things of which they have no knowledge.
translation: سُبْحَانَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ الْأَزْوَاجَ كُلَّهَا مِمَّا تُنْبِتُ الْأَرْضُ وَمِنْ أَنْفُسِهِمْ وَمِمَّا لَا يَعْلَمُونَ

phrase: And a Sign for them is the Night: We withdraw therefrom the Day, and behold they are plunged in darkness;
translation: وَآيَةٌ لَهُمُ اللَّيْلُ نَسْلَخُ مِنْهُ النَّهَارَ فَإِذَا هُمْ مُظْلِمُونَ

phrase: And the sun runs his course for a period determined for him: that is the decree of (Him), the Exalted in Might, the All-Knowing.
translation: وَالشَّمْسُ تَجْرِي لِمُسْتَقَرٍّ لَهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ تَقْدِيرُ الْعَزِيزِ الْعَلِيمِ

phrase: And the Moon,- We have measured for her mansions (to traverse) till she returns like the old (and withered) lower part of a date-stalk.
translation: وَالْقَمَرَ قَدَّرْنَاهُ مَنَازِلَ حَتَّىٰ عَادَ كَالْعُرْجُونِ الْقَدِيمِ

phrase: It is not permitted to the Sun to catch up the Moon, nor can the Night outstrip the Day: Each (just) swims along in (its own) orbit (according to Law).
translation: لَا الشَّمْسُ يَنْبَغِي لَهَا أَنْ تُدْرِكَ الْقَمَرَ وَلَا اللَّيْلُ سَابِقُ النَّهَارِ ۚ وَكُلٌّ فِي فَلَكٍ يَسْبَحُونَ

phrase: And a Sign for them is that We bore their race (through the Flood) in the loaded Ark;
translation: وَآيَةٌ لَهُمْ أَنَّا حَمَلْنَا ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ فِي الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ

phrase: And We have created for them similar (vessels) on which they ride.
translation: وَخَلَقْنَا لَهُمْ مِنْ مِثْلِهِ مَا يَرْكَبُونَ

phrase: If it were Our Will, We could drown them: then would there be no helper (to hear their cry), nor could they be delivered,
translation: وَإِنْ نَشَأْ نُغْرِقْهُمْ فَلَا صَرِيخَ لَهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنْقَذُونَ

phrase: Except by way of Mercy from Us, and by way of (world) convenience (to serve them) for a time.
translation: إِلَّا رَحْمَةً مِنَّا وَمَتَاعًا إِلَىٰ حِينٍ

phrase: When they are told, "Fear ye that which is before you and that which will be after you, in order that ye may receive Mercy," (they turn back).
translation: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ اتَّقُوا مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيكُمْ وَمَا خَلْفَكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
