phrase: While the Unbelievers got up in their hearts heat and cant - the heat and cant of ignorance,- Allah sent down His Tranquillity to his Messenger and to the Believers, and made them stick close to the command of self-restraint; and well were they entitled to it and worthy of it. And Allah has full knowledge of all things.
translation: إِذْ جَعَلَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فِي قُلُوبِهِمُ الْحَمِيَّةَ حَمِيَّةَ الْجَاهِلِيَّةِ فَأَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ سَكِينَتَهُ عَلَىٰ رَسُولِهِ وَعَلَى الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَأَلْزَمَهُمْ كَلِمَةَ التَّقْوَىٰ وَكَانُوا أَحَقَّ بِهَا وَأَهْلَهَا ۚ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمًا

phrase: Truly did Allah fulfil the vision for His Messenger: ye shall enter the Sacred Mosque, if Allah wills, with minds secure, heads shaved, hair cut short, and without fear. For He knew what ye knew not, and He granted, besides this, a speedy victory.
translation: لَقَدْ صَدَقَ اللَّهُ رَسُولَهُ الرُّؤْيَا بِالْحَقِّ ۖ لَتَدْخُلُنَّ الْمَسْجِدَ الْحَرَامَ إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ آمِنِينَ مُحَلِّقِينَ رُءُوسَكُمْ وَمُقَصِّرِينَ لَا تَخَافُونَ ۖ فَعَلِمَ مَا لَمْ تَعْلَمُوا فَجَعَلَ مِنْ دُونِ ذَٰلِكَ فَتْحًا قَرِيبًا

phrase: It is He Who has sent His Messenger with Guidance and the Religion of Truth, to proclaim it over all religion: and enough is Allah for a Witness.
translation: هُوَ الَّذِي أَرْسَلَ رَسُولَهُ بِالْهُدَىٰ وَدِينِ الْحَقِّ لِيُظْهِرَهُ عَلَى الدِّينِ كُلِّهِ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِاللَّهِ شَهِيدًا

phrase: Muhammad is the messenger of Allah; and those who are with him are strong against Unbelievers, (but) compassionate amongst each other. Thou wilt see them bow and prostrate themselves (in prayer), seeking Grace from Allah and (His) Good Pleasure. On their faces are their marks, (being) the traces of their prostration. This is their similitude in the Taurat; and their similitude in the Gospel is: like a seed which sends forth its blade, then makes it strong; it then becomes thick, and it stands on its own stem, (filling) the sowers with wonder and delight. As a result, it fills the Unbelievers with rage at them. Allah has promised those among them who believe and do righteous deeds forgiveness, and a great Reward.
translation: مُحَمَّدٌ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ۚ وَالَّذِينَ مَعَهُ أَشِدَّاءُ عَلَى الْكُفَّارِ رُحَمَاءُ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ تَرَاهُمْ رُكَّعًا سُجَّدًا يَبْتَغُونَ فَضْلًا مِنَ اللَّهِ وَرِضْوَانًا ۖ سِيمَاهُمْ فِي وُجُوهِهِمْ مِنْ أَثَرِ السُّجُودِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ مَثَلُهُمْ فِي التَّوْرَاةِ ۚ وَمَثَلُهُمْ فِي الْإِنْجِيلِ كَزَرْعٍ أَخْرَجَ شَطْأَهُ فَآزَرَهُ فَاسْتَغْلَظَ فَاسْتَوَىٰ عَلَىٰ سُوقِهِ يُعْجِبُ الزُّرَّاعَ لِيَغِيظَ بِهِمُ الْكُفَّارَ ۗ وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ مِنْهُمْ مَغْفِرَةً وَأَجْرًا عَظِيمًا

phrase: O Ye who believe! Put not yourselves forward before Allah and His Messenger; but fear Allah: for Allah is He Who hears and knows all things.
translation: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تُقَدِّمُوا بَيْنَ يَدَيِ اللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ

phrase: O ye who believe! Raise not your voices above the voice of the Prophet, nor speak aloud to him in talk, as ye may speak aloud to one another, lest your deeds become vain and ye perceive not.
translation: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَرْفَعُوا أَصْوَاتَكُمْ فَوْقَ صَوْتِ النَّبِيِّ وَلَا تَجْهَرُوا لَهُ بِالْقَوْلِ كَجَهْرِ بَعْضِكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ أَنْ تَحْبَطَ أَعْمَالُكُمْ وَأَنْتُمْ لَا تَشْعُرُونَ

phrase: Those that lower their voices in the presence of Allah´s Messenger,- their hearts has Allah tested for piety: for them is Forgiveness and a great Reward.
translation: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَغُضُّونَ أَصْوَاتَهُمْ عِنْدَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ امْتَحَنَ اللَّهُ قُلُوبَهُمْ لِلتَّقْوَىٰ ۚ لَهُمْ مَغْفِرَةٌ وَأَجْرٌ عَظِيمٌ

phrase: Those who shout out to thee from without the inner apartments - most of them lack understanding.
translation: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يُنَادُونَكَ مِنْ وَرَاءِ الْحُجُرَاتِ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ

phrase: If only they had patience until thou couldst come out to them, it would be best for them: but Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
translation: وَلَوْ أَنَّهُمْ صَبَرُوا حَتَّىٰ تَخْرُجَ إِلَيْهِمْ لَكَانَ خَيْرًا لَهُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ

phrase: O ye who believe! If a wicked person comes to you with any news, ascertain the truth, lest ye harm people unwittingly, and afterwards become full of repentance for what ye have done.
translation: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِنْ جَاءَكُمْ فَاسِقٌ بِنَبَإٍ فَتَبَيَّنُوا أَنْ تُصِيبُوا قَوْمًا بِجَهَالَةٍ فَتُصْبِحُوا عَلَىٰ مَا فَعَلْتُمْ نَادِمِينَ

phrase: And know that among you is Allah´s Messenger: were he, in many matters, to follow your (wishes), ye would certainly fall into misfortune: But Allah has endeared the Faith to you, and has made it beautiful in your hearts, and He has made hateful to you Unbelief, wickedness, and rebellion: such indeed are those who walk in righteousness;-
translation: وَاعْلَمُوا أَنَّ فِيكُمْ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ۚ لَوْ يُطِيعُكُمْ فِي كَثِيرٍ مِنَ الْأَمْرِ لَعَنِتُّمْ وَلَٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ حَبَّبَ إِلَيْكُمُ الْإِيمَانَ وَزَيَّنَهُ فِي قُلُوبِكُمْ وَكَرَّهَ إِلَيْكُمُ الْكُفْرَ وَالْفُسُوقَ وَالْعِصْيَانَ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الرَّاشِدُونَ

phrase: A Grace and Favour from Allah; and Allah is full of Knowledge and Wisdom.
translation: فَضْلًا مِنَ اللَّهِ وَنِعْمَةً ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ

phrase: If two parties among the Believers fall into a quarrel, make ye peace between them: but if one of them transgresses beyond bounds against the other, then fight ye (all) against the one that transgresses until it complies with the command of Allah; but if it complies, then make peace between them with justice, and be fair: for Allah loves those who are fair (and just).
translation: وَإِنْ طَائِفَتَانِ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ اقْتَتَلُوا فَأَصْلِحُوا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ فَإِنْ بَغَتْ إِحْدَاهُمَا عَلَى الْأُخْرَىٰ فَقَاتِلُوا الَّتِي تَبْغِي حَتَّىٰ تَفِيءَ إِلَىٰ أَمْرِ اللَّهِ ۚ فَإِنْ فَاءَتْ فَأَصْلِحُوا بَيْنَهُمَا بِالْعَدْلِ وَأَقْسِطُوا ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ الْمُقْسِطِينَ

phrase: The Believers are but a single Brotherhood: So make peace and reconciliation between your two (contending) brothers; and fear Allah, that ye may receive Mercy.
translation: إِنَّمَا الْمُؤْمِنُونَ إِخْوَةٌ فَأَصْلِحُوا بَيْنَ أَخَوَيْكُمْ ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ

phrase: O ye who believe! Let not some men among you laugh at others: It may be that the (latter) are better than the (former): Nor let some women laugh at others: It may be that the (latter are better than the (former): Nor defame nor be sarcastic to each other, nor call each other by (offensive) nicknames: Ill-seeming is a name connoting wickedness, (to be used of one) after he has believed: And those who do not desist are (indeed) doing wrong.
translation: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا يَسْخَرْ قَوْمٌ مِنْ قَوْمٍ عَسَىٰ أَنْ يَكُونُوا خَيْرًا مِنْهُمْ وَلَا نِسَاءٌ مِنْ نِسَاءٍ عَسَىٰ أَنْ يَكُنَّ خَيْرًا مِنْهُنَّ ۖ وَلَا تَلْمِزُوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ وَلَا تَنَابَزُوا بِالْأَلْقَابِ ۖ بِئْسَ الِاسْمُ الْفُسُوقُ بَعْدَ الْإِيمَانِ ۚ وَمَنْ لَمْ يَتُبْ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الظَّالِمُونَ

phrase: O ye who believe! Avoid suspicion as much (as possible): for suspicion in some cases is a sin: And spy not on each other behind their backs. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? Nay, ye would abhor it...But fear Allah: For Allah is Oft-Returning, Most Merciful.
translation: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اجْتَنِبُوا كَثِيرًا مِنَ الظَّنِّ إِنَّ بَعْضَ الظَّنِّ إِثْمٌ ۖ وَلَا تَجَسَّسُوا وَلَا يَغْتَبْ بَعْضُكُمْ بَعْضًا ۚ أَيُحِبُّ أَحَدُكُمْ أَنْ يَأْكُلَ لَحْمَ أَخِيهِ مَيْتًا فَكَرِهْتُمُوهُ ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ تَوَّابٌ رَحِيمٌ

phrase: O mankind! We created you from a single (pair) of a male and a female, and made you into nations and tribes, that ye may know each other (not that ye may despise (each other). Verily the most honoured of you in the sight of Allah is (he who is) the most righteous of you. And Allah has full knowledge and is well acquainted (with all things).
translation: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَاكُمْ مِنْ ذَكَرٍ وَأُنْثَىٰ وَجَعَلْنَاكُمْ شُعُوبًا وَقَبَائِلَ لِتَعَارَفُوا ۚ إِنَّ أَكْرَمَكُمْ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ أَتْقَاكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلِيمٌ خَبِيرٌ

phrase: The desert Arabs say, "We believe." Say, "Ye have no faith; but ye (only)say, ´We have submitted our wills to Allah,´ For not yet has Faith entered your hearts. But if ye obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not belittle aught of your deeds: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful."
translation: قَالَتِ الْأَعْرَابُ آمَنَّا ۖ قُلْ لَمْ تُؤْمِنُوا وَلَٰكِنْ قُولُوا أَسْلَمْنَا وَلَمَّا يَدْخُلِ الْإِيمَانُ فِي قُلُوبِكُمْ ۖ وَإِنْ تُطِيعُوا اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ لَا يَلِتْكُمْ مِنْ أَعْمَالِكُمْ شَيْئًا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ

phrase: Only those are Believers who have believed in Allah and His Messenger, and have never since doubted, but have striven with their belongings and their persons in the Cause of Allah: Such are the sincere ones.
translation: إِنَّمَا الْمُؤْمِنُونَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَرْتَابُوا وَجَاهَدُوا بِأَمْوَالِهِمْ وَأَنْفُسِهِمْ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الصَّادِقُونَ

phrase: Say: "What! Will ye instruct Allah about your religion? But Allah knows all that is in the heavens and on earth: He has full knowledge of all things.
translation: قُلْ أَتُعَلِّمُونَ اللَّهَ بِدِينِكُمْ وَاللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ

phrase: They impress on thee as a favour that they have embraced Islam. Say, "Count not your Islam as a favour upon me: Nay, Allah has conferred a favour upon you that He has guided you to the faith, if ye be true and sincere.
translation: يَمُنُّونَ عَلَيْكَ أَنْ أَسْلَمُوا ۖ قُلْ لَا تَمُنُّوا عَلَيَّ إِسْلَامَكُمْ ۖ بَلِ اللَّهُ يَمُنُّ عَلَيْكُمْ أَنْ هَدَاكُمْ لِلْإِيمَانِ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ

phrase: "Verily Allah knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth: and Allah Sees well all that ye do."
translation: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ غَيْبَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بَصِيرٌ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ

phrase: Qaf: By the Glorious Qur´an (Thou art Allah´s Messenger).
translation: ق ۚ وَالْقُرْآنِ الْمَجِيدِ

phrase: But they wonder that there has come to them a Warner from among themselves. So the Unbelievers say: "This is a wonderful thing!
translation: بَلْ عَجِبُوا أَنْ جَاءَهُمْ مُنْذِرٌ مِنْهُمْ فَقَالَ الْكَافِرُونَ هَٰذَا شَيْءٌ عَجِيبٌ

phrase: "What! When we die and become dust, (shall we live again?) That is a (sort of) return far (from our understanding)."
translation: أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا ۖ ذَٰلِكَ رَجْعٌ بَعِيدٌ

phrase: We already know how much of them the earth takes away: With Us is a record guarding (the full account).
translation: قَدْ عَلِمْنَا مَا تَنْقُصُ الْأَرْضُ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَعِنْدَنَا كِتَابٌ حَفِيظٌ

phrase: But they deny the Truth when it comes to them: so they are in a confused state.
translation: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا بِالْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَاءَهُمْ فَهُمْ فِي أَمْرٍ مَرِيجٍ

phrase: Do they not look at the sky above them?- How We have made it and adorned it, and there are no flaws in it?
translation: أَفَلَمْ يَنْظُرُوا إِلَى السَّمَاءِ فَوْقَهُمْ كَيْفَ بَنَيْنَاهَا وَزَيَّنَّاهَا وَمَا لَهَا مِنْ فُرُوجٍ

phrase: And the earth- We have spread it out, and set thereon mountains standing firm, and produced therein every kind of beautiful growth (in pairs)-
translation: وَالْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَاهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ وَأَنْبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِنْ كُلِّ زَوْجٍ بَهِيجٍ

phrase: To be observed and commemorated by every devotee turning (to Allah).
translation: تَبْصِرَةً وَذِكْرَىٰ لِكُلِّ عَبْدٍ مُنِيبٍ

phrase: And We send down from the sky rain charted with blessing, and We produce therewith gardens and Grain for harvests;
translation: وَنَزَّلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً مُبَارَكًا فَأَنْبَتْنَا بِهِ جَنَّاتٍ وَحَبَّ الْحَصِيدِ

phrase: And tall (and stately) palm-trees, with shoots of fruit-stalks, piled one over another;-
translation: وَالنَّخْلَ بَاسِقَاتٍ لَهَا طَلْعٌ نَضِيدٌ

phrase: As sustenance for (Allah´s) Servants;- and We give (new) life therewith to land that is dead: Thus will be the Resurrection.
translation: رِزْقًا لِلْعِبَادِ ۖ وَأَحْيَيْنَا بِهِ بَلْدَةً مَيْتًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ الْخُرُوجُ

phrase: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,
translation: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَأَصْحَابُ الرَّسِّ وَثَمُودُ

phrase: The ´Ad, Pharaoh, the brethren of Lut,
translation: وَعَادٌ وَفِرْعَوْنُ وَإِخْوَانُ لُوطٍ

phrase: The Companions of the Wood, and the People of Tubba´; each one (of them) rejected the messengers, and My warning was duly fulfilled (in them).
translation: وَأَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ وَقَوْمُ تُبَّعٍ ۚ كُلٌّ كَذَّبَ الرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ وَعِيدِ

phrase: Were We then weary with the first Creation, that they should be in confused doubt about a new Creation?
translation: أَفَعَيِينَا بِالْخَلْقِ الْأَوَّلِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِي لَبْسٍ مِنْ خَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ

phrase: It was We Who created man, and We know what dark suggestions his soul makes to him: for We are nearer to him than (his) jugular vein.
translation: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ وَنَعْلَمُ مَا تُوَسْوِسُ بِهِ نَفْسُهُ ۖ وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنْ حَبْلِ الْوَرِيدِ

phrase: Behold, two (guardian angels) appointed to learn (his doings) learn (and noted them), one sitting on the right and one on the left.
translation: إِذْ يَتَلَقَّى الْمُتَلَقِّيَانِ عَنِ الْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ الشِّمَالِ قَعِيدٌ

phrase: Not a word does he utter but there is a sentinel by him, ready (to note it).
translation: مَا يَلْفِظُ مِنْ قَوْلٍ إِلَّا لَدَيْهِ رَقِيبٌ عَتِيدٌ

phrase: And the stupor of death will bring Truth (before his eyes): "This was the thing which thou wast trying to escape!"
translation: وَجَاءَتْ سَكْرَةُ الْمَوْتِ بِالْحَقِّ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنْتَ مِنْهُ تَحِيدُ

phrase: And the Trumpet shall be blown: that will be the Day whereof Warning (had been given).
translation: وَنُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْوَعِيدِ

phrase: And there will come forth every soul: with each will be an (angel) to drive, and an (angel) to bear witness.
translation: وَجَاءَتْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَعَهَا سَائِقٌ وَشَهِيدٌ

phrase: (It will be said:) "Thou wast heedless of this; now have We removed thy veil, and sharp is thy sight this Day!"
translation: لَقَدْ كُنْتَ فِي غَفْلَةٍ مِنْ هَٰذَا فَكَشَفْنَا عَنْكَ غِطَاءَكَ فَبَصَرُكَ الْيَوْمَ حَدِيدٌ

phrase: And his Companion will say: "Here is (his Record) ready with me!"
translation: وَقَالَ قَرِينُهُ هَٰذَا مَا لَدَيَّ عَتِيدٌ

phrase: (The sentence will be:) "Throw, throw into Hell every contumacious Rejecter (of Allah)!-
translation: أَلْقِيَا فِي جَهَنَّمَ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ عَنِيدٍ

phrase: "Who forbade what was good, transgressed all bounds, cast doubts and suspicions;
translation: مَنَّاعٍ لِلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍ مُرِيبٍ

phrase: "Who set up another god beside Allah: Throw him into a severe penalty."
translation: الَّذِي جَعَلَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ فَأَلْقِيَاهُ فِي الْعَذَابِ الشَّدِيدِ

phrase: His Companion will say: "Our Lord! I did not make him transgress, but he was (himself) far astray."
translation: قَالَ قَرِينُهُ رَبَّنَا مَا أَطْغَيْتُهُ وَلَٰكِنْ كَانَ فِي ضَلَالٍ بَعِيدٍ

phrase: He will say: "Dispute not with each other in My Presence: I had already in advance sent you Warning.
translation: قَالَ لَا تَخْتَصِمُوا لَدَيَّ وَقَدْ قَدَّمْتُ إِلَيْكُمْ بِالْوَعِيدِ

phrase: "The Word changes not before Me, and I do not the least injustice to My Servants."
translation: مَا يُبَدَّلُ الْقَوْلُ لَدَيَّ وَمَا أَنَا بِظَلَّامٍ لِلْعَبِيدِ

phrase: One Day We will ask Hell, "Art thou filled to the full?" It will say, "Are there any more (to come)?"
translation: يَوْمَ نَقُولُ لِجَهَنَّمَ هَلِ امْتَلَأْتِ وَتَقُولُ هَلْ مِنْ مَزِيدٍ

phrase: And the Garden will be brought nigh to the Righteous,- no more a thing distant.
translation: وَأُزْلِفَتِ الْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ

phrase: (A voice will say:) "This is what was promised for you,- for every one who turned (to Allah) in sincere repentance, who kept (His Law),
translation: هَٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِكُلِّ أَوَّابٍ حَفِيظٍ

phrase: "Who feared (Allah) Most Gracious Unseen, and brought a heart turned in devotion (to Him):
translation: مَنْ خَشِيَ الرَّحْمَٰنَ بِالْغَيْبِ وَجَاءَ بِقَلْبٍ مُنِيبٍ

phrase: "Enter ye therein in Peace and Security; this is a Day of Eternal Life!"
translation: ادْخُلُوهَا بِسَلَامٍ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْخُلُودِ

phrase: There will be for them therein all that they wish,- and more besides in Our Presence.
translation: لَهُمْ مَا يَشَاءُونَ فِيهَا وَلَدَيْنَا مَزِيدٌ

phrase: But how many generations before them did We destroy (for their sins),- stronger in power than they? Then did they wander through the land: was there any place of escape (for them)?
translation: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُمْ مِنْ قَرْنٍ هُمْ أَشَدُّ مِنْهُمْ بَطْشًا فَنَقَّبُوا فِي الْبِلَادِ هَلْ مِنْ مَحِيصٍ

phrase: Verily in this is a Message for any that has a heart and understanding or who gives ear and earnestly witnesses (the truth).
translation: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكْرَىٰ لِمَنْ كَانَ لَهُ قَلْبٌ أَوْ أَلْقَى السَّمْعَ وَهُوَ شَهِيدٌ

phrase: We created the heavens and the earth and all between them in Six Days, nor did any sense of weariness touch Us.
translation: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ وَمَا مَسَّنَا مِنْ لُغُوبٍ

phrase: Bear, then, with patience, all that they say, and celebrate the praises of thy Lord, before the rising of the sun and before (its) setting.
translation: فَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ الشَّمْسِ وَقَبْلَ الْغُرُوبِ

phrase: And during part of the night, (also,) celebrate His praises, and (so likewise) after the postures of adoration.
translation: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَأَدْبَارَ السُّجُودِ

phrase: And listen for the Day when the Caller will call out from a place quiet near,-
translation: وَاسْتَمِعْ يَوْمَ يُنَادِ الْمُنَادِ مِنْ مَكَانٍ قَرِيبٍ

phrase: The Day when they will hear a (mighty) Blast in (very) truth: that will be the Day of Resurrection.
translation: يَوْمَ يَسْمَعُونَ الصَّيْحَةَ بِالْحَقِّ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْخُرُوجِ

phrase: Verily it is We Who give Life and Death; and to Us is the Final Goal-
translation: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نُحْيِي وَنُمِيتُ وَإِلَيْنَا الْمَصِيرُ

phrase: The Day when the Earth will be rent asunder, from (men) hurrying out: that will be a gathering together,- quite easy for Us.
translation: يَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ الْأَرْضُ عَنْهُمْ سِرَاعًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ حَشْرٌ عَلَيْنَا يَسِيرٌ

phrase: We know best what they say; and thou art not one to overawe them by force. So admonish with the Qur´an such as fear My Warning!
translation: نَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ ۖ وَمَا أَنْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ بِجَبَّارٍ ۖ فَذَكِّرْ بِالْقُرْآنِ مَنْ يَخَافُ وَعِيدِ

phrase: By the (Winds) that scatter broadcast;
translation: وَالذَّارِيَاتِ ذَرْوًا

phrase: And those that lift and bear away heavy weights;
translation: فَالْحَامِلَاتِ وِقْرًا

phrase: And those that flow with ease and gentleness;
translation: فَالْجَارِيَاتِ يُسْرًا

phrase: And those that distribute and apportion by Command;-
translation: فَالْمُقَسِّمَاتِ أَمْرًا

phrase: Verily that which ye are promised is true;
translation: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقٌ

phrase: And verily Judgment and Justice must indeed come to pass.
translation: وَإِنَّ الدِّينَ لَوَاقِعٌ

phrase: By the Sky with (its) numerous Paths,
translation: وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الْحُبُكِ

phrase: Truly ye are in a doctrine discordant,
translation: إِنَّكُمْ لَفِي قَوْلٍ مُخْتَلِفٍ

phrase: Through which are deluded (away from the Truth) such as would be deluded.
translation: يُؤْفَكُ عَنْهُ مَنْ أُفِكَ

phrase: Woe to the falsehood-mongers,-
translation: قُتِلَ الْخَرَّاصُونَ

phrase: Those who (flounder) heedless in a flood of confusion:
translation: الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي غَمْرَةٍ سَاهُونَ

phrase: They ask, "When will be the Day of Judgment and Justice?"
translation: يَسْأَلُونَ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ الدِّينِ

phrase: (It will be) a Day when they will be tried (and tested) over the Fire!
translation: يَوْمَ هُمْ عَلَى النَّارِ يُفْتَنُونَ

phrase: "Taste ye your trial! This is what ye used to ask to be hastened!"
translation: ذُوقُوا فِتْنَتَكُمْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ

phrase: Taking joy in the things which their Lord gives them, because, before then, they lived a good life.
translation: آخِذِينَ مَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحْسِنِينَ

phrase: They were in the habit of sleeping but little by night,
translation: كَانُوا قَلِيلًا مِنَ اللَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ

phrase: And in the hour of early dawn, they (were found) praying for Forgiveness;
translation: وَبِالْأَسْحَارِ هُمْ يَسْتَغْفِرُونَ

phrase: And in their wealth and possessions (was remembered) the right of the (needy,) him who asked, and him who (for some reason) was prevented (from asking).
translation: وَفِي أَمْوَالِهِمْ حَقٌّ لِلسَّائِلِ وَالْمَحْرُومِ

phrase: On the earth are signs for those of assured Faith,
translation: وَفِي الْأَرْضِ آيَاتٌ لِلْمُوقِنِينَ

phrase: As also in your own selves: Will ye not then see?
translation: وَفِي أَنْفُسِكُمْ ۚ أَفَلَا تُبْصِرُونَ

phrase: And in heaven is your Sustenance, as (also) that which ye are promised.
translation: وَفِي السَّمَاءِ رِزْقُكُمْ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ

phrase: Then, by the Lord of heaven and earth, this is the very Truth, as much as the fact that ye can speak intelligently to each other.
translation: فَوَرَبِّ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ إِنَّهُ لَحَقٌّ مِثْلَ مَا أَنَّكُمْ تَنْطِقُونَ

phrase: Has the story reached thee, of the honoured guests of Abraham?
translation: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيْفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ الْمُكْرَمِينَ

phrase: Behold, they entered his presence, and said: "Peace!" He said, "Peace!" (and thought, "These seem) unusual people."
translation: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا سَلَامًا ۖ قَالَ سَلَامٌ قَوْمٌ مُنْكَرُونَ

phrase: Then he turned quickly to his household, brought out a fatted calf,
translation: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ فَجَاءَ بِعِجْلٍ سَمِينٍ

phrase: And placed it before them.. he said, "Will ye not eat?"
translation: فَقَرَّبَهُ إِلَيْهِمْ قَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ

phrase: (When they did not eat), He conceived a fear of them. They said, "Fear not," and they gave him glad tidings of a son endowed with knowledge.
translation: فَأَوْجَسَ مِنْهُمْ خِيفَةً ۖ قَالُوا لَا تَخَفْ ۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَامٍ عَلِيمٍ

phrase: But his wife came forward (laughing) aloud: she smote her forehead and said: "A barren old woman!"
translation: فَأَقْبَلَتِ امْرَأَتُهُ فِي صَرَّةٍ فَصَكَّتْ وَجْهَهَا وَقَالَتْ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٌ

phrase: They said, "Even so has thy Lord spoken: and He is full of Wisdom and Knowledge."
translation: قَالُوا كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْحَكِيمُ الْعَلِيمُ

phrase: "To bring on, on them, (a shower of) stones of clay (brimstone),
translation: لِنُرْسِلَ عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِنْ طِينٍ

phrase: "Marked as from thy Lord for those who trespass beyond bounds."
translation: مُسَوَّمَةً عِنْدَ رَبِّكَ لِلْمُسْرِفِينَ

phrase: Then We evacuated those of the Believers who were there,
translation: فَأَخْرَجْنَا مَنْ كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

phrase: But We found not there any just (Muslim) persons except in one house:
translation: فَمَا وَجَدْنَا فِيهَا غَيْرَ بَيْتٍ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ

phrase: And We left there a Sign for such as fear the Grievous Penalty.
translation: وَتَرَكْنَا فِيهَا آيَةً لِلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ

phrase: And in Moses (was another Sign): Behold, We sent him to Pharaoh, with authority manifest.
translation: وَفِي مُوسَىٰ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَاهُ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ بِسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ

phrase: But (Pharaoh) turned back with his Chiefs, and said, "A sorcerer, or one possessed!"
translation: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكْنِهِ وَقَالَ سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ

phrase: So We took him and his forces, and threw them into the sea; and his was the blame.
translation: فَأَخَذْنَاهُ وَجُنُودَهُ فَنَبَذْنَاهُمْ فِي الْيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٌ

phrase: And in the ´Ad (people) (was another Sign): Behold, We sent against them the devastating Wind:
translation: وَفِي عَادٍ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ الرِّيحَ الْعَقِيمَ

phrase: It left nothing whatever that it came up against, but reduced it to ruin and rottenness.
translation: مَا تَذَرُ مِنْ شَيْءٍ أَتَتْ عَلَيْهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتْهُ كَالرَّمِيمِ

phrase: And in the Thamud (was another Sign): Behold, they were told, "Enjoy (your brief day) for a little while!"
translation: وَفِي ثَمُودَ إِذْ قِيلَ لَهُمْ تَمَتَّعُوا حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ

phrase: But they insolently defied the Command of their Lord: So the stunning noise (of an earthquake) seized them, even while they were looking on.
translation: فَعَتَوْا عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّاعِقَةُ وَهُمْ يَنْظُرُونَ

phrase: Then they could not even stand (on their feet), nor could they help themselves.
translation: فَمَا اسْتَطَاعُوا مِنْ قِيَامٍ وَمَا كَانُوا مُنْتَصِرِينَ

phrase: So were the People of Noah before them for they wickedly transgressed.
translation: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِنْ قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ

phrase: With power and skill did We construct the Firmament: for it is We Who create the vastness of pace.
translation: وَالسَّمَاءَ بَنَيْنَاهَا بِأَيْدٍ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ

phrase: And We have spread out the (spacious) earth: How excellently We do spread out!
translation: وَالْأَرْضَ فَرَشْنَاهَا فَنِعْمَ الْمَاهِدُونَ

phrase: And of every thing We have created pairs: That ye may receive instruction.
translation: وَمِنْ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقْنَا زَوْجَيْنِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ

phrase: Hasten ye then (at once) to Allah: I am from Him a Warner to you, clear and open!
translation: فَفِرُّوا إِلَى اللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُمْ مِنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ

phrase: And make not another an object of worship with Allah: I am from Him a Warner to you, clear and open!
translation: وَلَا تَجْعَلُوا مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُمْ مِنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ

phrase: Similarly, no messenger came to the Peoples before them, but they said (of him) in like manner, "A sorcerer, or one possessed"!
translation: كَذَٰلِكَ مَا أَتَى الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ مِنْ رَسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُوا سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ

phrase: Is this the legacy they have transmitted, one to another? Nay, they are themselves a people transgressing beyond bounds!
translation: أَتَوَاصَوْا بِهِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ

phrase: So turn away from them: not thine is the blame.
translation: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَمَا أَنْتَ بِمَلُومٍ

phrase: But teach (thy Message) for teaching benefits the Believers.
translation: وَذَكِّرْ فَإِنَّ الذِّكْرَىٰ تَنْفَعُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

phrase: I have only created Jinns and men, that they may serve Me.
translation: وَمَا خَلَقْتُ الْجِنَّ وَالْإِنْسَ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُونِ

phrase: No Sustenance do I require of them, nor do I require that they should feed Me.
translation: مَا أُرِيدُ مِنْهُمْ مِنْ رِزْقٍ وَمَا أُرِيدُ أَنْ يُطْعِمُونِ

phrase: For Allah is He Who gives (all) Sustenance,- Lord of Power,- Steadfast (for ever).
translation: إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الرَّزَّاقُ ذُو الْقُوَّةِ الْمَتِينُ

phrase: For the Wrong-doers, their portion is like unto the portion of their fellows (of earlier generations): then let them not ask Me to hasten (that portion)!
translation: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا ذَنُوبًا مِثْلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصْحَابِهِمْ فَلَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونِ

phrase: Woe, then, to the Unbelievers, on account of that Day of theirs which they have been promised!
translation: فَوَيْلٌ لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ يَوْمِهِمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ

phrase: By the Mount (of Revelation);
translation: وَالطُّورِ

phrase: By a Decree inscribed
translation: وَكِتَابٍ مَسْطُورٍ

phrase: In a Scroll unfolded;
translation: فِي رَقٍّ مَنْشُورٍ

phrase: By the much-frequented Fane;
translation: وَالْبَيْتِ الْمَعْمُورِ

phrase: By the Canopy Raised High;
translation: وَالسَّقْفِ الْمَرْفُوعِ

phrase: And by the Ocean filled with Swell;-
translation: وَالْبَحْرِ الْمَسْجُورِ

phrase: Verily, the Doom of thy Lord will indeed come to pass;-
translation: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ لَوَاقِعٌ

phrase: There is none can avert it;-
translation: مَا لَهُ مِنْ دَافِعٍ

phrase: On the Day when the firmament will be in dreadful commotion.
translation: يَوْمَ تَمُورُ السَّمَاءُ مَوْرًا

phrase: And the mountains will fly hither and thither.
translation: وَتَسِيرُ الْجِبَالُ سَيْرًا

phrase: Then woe that Day to those that treat (Truth) as Falsehood;-
translation: فَوَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ

phrase: That play (and paddle) in shallow trifles.
translation: الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي خَوْضٍ يَلْعَبُونَ

phrase: That Day shall they be thrust down to the Fire of Hell, irresistibly.
translation: يَوْمَ يُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا

phrase: "This:, it will be said, "Is the Fire,- which ye were wont to deny!
translation: هَٰذِهِ النَّارُ الَّتِي كُنْتُمْ بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ

phrase: "Is this then a fake, or is it ye that do not see?
translation: أَفَسِحْرٌ هَٰذَا أَمْ أَنْتُمْ لَا تُبْصِرُونَ

phrase: "Burn ye therein: the same is it to you whether ye bear it with patience, or not: Ye but receive the recompense of your (own) deeds."
translation: اصْلَوْهَا فَاصْبِرُوا أَوْ لَا تَصْبِرُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ

phrase: As to the Righteous, they will be in Gardens, and in Happiness,-
translation: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَنَعِيمٍ

phrase: Enjoying the (Bliss) which their Lord hath bestowed on them, and their Lord shall deliver them from the Penalty of the Fire.
translation: فَاكِهِينَ بِمَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ وَوَقَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ عَذَابَ الْجَحِيمِ

phrase: (To them will be said:) "Eat and drink ye, with profit and health, because of your (good) deeds."
translation: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ

phrase: They will recline (with ease) on Thrones (of dignity) arranged in ranks; and We shall join them to Companions, with beautiful big and lustrous eyes.
translation: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَصْفُوفَةٍ ۖ وَزَوَّجْنَاهُمْ بِحُورٍ عِينٍ

phrase: And those who believe and whose families follow them in Faith,- to them shall We join their families: Nor shall We deprive them (of the fruit) of aught of their works: (Yet) is each individual in pledge for his deeds.
translation: وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَاتَّبَعَتْهُمْ ذُرِّيَّتُهُمْ بِإِيمَانٍ أَلْحَقْنَا بِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ وَمَا أَلَتْنَاهُمْ مِنْ عَمَلِهِمْ مِنْ شَيْءٍ ۚ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِينٌ

phrase: And We shall bestow on them, of fruit and meat, anything they shall desire.
translation: وَأَمْدَدْنَاهُمْ بِفَاكِهَةٍ وَلَحْمٍ مِمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ

phrase: They shall there exchange, one with another, a (loving) cup free of frivolity, free of all taint of ill.
translation: يَتَنَازَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا لَا لَغْوٌ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأْثِيمٌ

phrase: Round about them will serve, (devoted) to them, young male servants (handsome) as Pearls well-guarded.
translation: وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ غِلْمَانٌ لَهُمْ كَأَنَّهُمْ لُؤْلُؤٌ مَكْنُونٌ

phrase: They will say: "Aforetime, we were not without fear for the sake of our people.
translation: قَالُوا إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبْلُ فِي أَهْلِنَا مُشْفِقِينَ

phrase: "But Allah has been good to us, and has delivered us from the Penalty of the Scorching Wind.
translation: فَمَنَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا وَوَقَانَا عَذَابَ السَّمُومِ

phrase: "Truly, we did call unto Him from of old: truly it is He, the Beneficent, the Merciful!"
translation: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِنْ قَبْلُ نَدْعُوهُ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْبَرُّ الرَّحِيمُ

phrase: Therefore proclaim thou the praises (of thy Lord): for by the Grace of thy Lord, thou art no (vulgar) soothsayer, nor art thou one possessed.
translation: فَذَكِّرْ فَمَا أَنْتَ بِنِعْمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنٍ وَلَا مَجْنُونٍ

phrase: Or do they say:- "A Poet! we await for him some calamity (hatched) by Time!"
translation: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٌ نَتَرَبَّصُ بِهِ رَيْبَ الْمَنُونِ

phrase: Say thou: "Await ye!- I too will wait along with you!"
translation: قُلْ تَرَبَّصُوا فَإِنِّي مَعَكُمْ مِنَ الْمُتَرَبِّصِينَ

phrase: Is it that their faculties of understanding urge them to this, or are they but a people transgressing beyond bounds?
translation: أَمْ تَأْمُرُهُمْ أَحْلَامُهُمْ بِهَٰذَا ۚ أَمْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ

phrase: Or do they say, "He fabricated the (Message)"? Nay, they have no faith!
translation: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُ ۚ بَلْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ

phrase: Let them then produce a recital like unto it,- If (it be) they speak the truth!
translation: فَلْيَأْتُوا بِحَدِيثٍ مِثْلِهِ إِنْ كَانُوا صَادِقِينَ

phrase: Were they created of nothing, or were they themselves the creators?
translation: أَمْ خُلِقُوا مِنْ غَيْرِ شَيْءٍ أَمْ هُمُ الْخَالِقُونَ

phrase: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Nay, they have no firm belief.
translation: أَمْ خَلَقُوا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۚ بَلْ لَا يُوقِنُونَ

phrase: Or are the Treasures of thy Lord with them, or are they the managers (of affairs)?
translation: أَمْ عِنْدَهُمْ خَزَائِنُ رَبِّكَ أَمْ هُمُ الْمُصَيْطِرُونَ

phrase: Or have they a ladder, by which they can (climb up to heaven and) listen (to its secrets)? Then let (such a) listener of theirs produce a manifest proof.
translation: أَمْ لَهُمْ سُلَّمٌ يَسْتَمِعُونَ فِيهِ ۖ فَلْيَأْتِ مُسْتَمِعُهُمْ بِسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ

phrase: Or has He only daughters and ye have sons?
translation: أَمْ لَهُ الْبَنَاتُ وَلَكُمُ الْبَنُونَ

phrase: Or is it that thou dost ask for a reward, so that they are burdened with a load of debt?-
translation: أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُمْ مِنْ مَغْرَمٍ مُثْقَلُونَ

phrase: Or that the Unseen in it their hands, and they write it down?
translation: أَمْ عِنْدَهُمُ الْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ

phrase: Or do they intend a plot (against thee)? But those who defy Allah are themselves involved in a Plot!
translation: أَمْ يُرِيدُونَ كَيْدًا ۖ فَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا هُمُ الْمَكِيدُونَ

phrase: Or have they a god other than Allah? Exalted is Allah far above the things they associate with Him!
translation: أَمْ لَهُمْ إِلَٰهٌ غَيْرُ اللَّهِ ۚ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ

phrase: Were they to see a piece of the sky falling (on them), they would (only) say: "Clouds gathered in heaps!"
translation: وَإِنْ يَرَوْا كِسْفًا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ سَاقِطًا يَقُولُوا سَحَابٌ مَرْكُومٌ

phrase: So leave them alone until they encounter that Day of theirs, wherein they shall (perforce) swoon (with terror),-
translation: فَذَرْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي فِيهِ يُصْعَقُونَ

phrase: The Day when their plotting will avail them nothing and no help shall be given them.
translation: يَوْمَ لَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْئًا وَلَا هُمْ يُنْصَرُونَ

phrase: And verily, for those who do wrong, there is another punishment besides this: But most of them understand not.
translation: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا عَذَابًا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ

phrase: Now await in patience the command of thy Lord: for verily thou art in Our eyes: and celebrate the praises of thy Lord the while thou standest forth,
translation: وَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا ۖ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ

phrase: And for part of the night also praise thou Him,- and at the retreat of the stars!
translation: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَإِدْبَارَ النُّجُومِ

phrase: By the Star when it goes down,-
translation: وَالنَّجْمِ إِذَا هَوَىٰ

phrase: Your Companion is neither astray nor being misled.
translation: مَا ضَلَّ صَاحِبُكُمْ وَمَا غَوَىٰ

phrase: Nor does he say (aught) of (his own) Desire.
translation: وَمَا يَنْطِقُ عَنِ الْهَوَىٰ

phrase: It is no less than inspiration sent down to him:
translation: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا وَحْيٌ يُوحَىٰ

phrase: He was taught by one Mighty in Power,
translation: عَلَّمَهُ شَدِيدُ الْقُوَىٰ

phrase: Endued with Wisdom: for he appeared (in stately form);
translation: ذُو مِرَّةٍ فَاسْتَوَىٰ

phrase: While he was in the highest part of the horizon:
translation: وَهُوَ بِالْأُفُقِ الْأَعْلَىٰ

phrase: Then he approached and came closer,
translation: ثُمَّ دَنَا فَتَدَلَّىٰ

phrase: And was at a distance of but two bow-lengths or (even) nearer;
translation: فَكَانَ قَابَ قَوْسَيْنِ أَوْ أَدْنَىٰ

phrase: So did (Allah) convey the inspiration to His Servant- (conveyed) what He (meant) to convey.
translation: فَأَوْحَىٰ إِلَىٰ عَبْدِهِ مَا أَوْحَىٰ

phrase: The (Prophet´s) (mind and) heart in no way falsified that which he saw.
translation: مَا كَذَبَ الْفُؤَادُ مَا رَأَىٰ

phrase: Will ye then dispute with him concerning what he saw?
translation: أَفَتُمَارُونَهُ عَلَىٰ مَا يَرَىٰ

phrase: For indeed he saw him at a second descent,
translation: وَلَقَدْ رَآهُ نَزْلَةً أُخْرَىٰ

phrase: Near the Lote-tree beyond which none may pass:
translation: عِنْدَ سِدْرَةِ الْمُنْتَهَىٰ

phrase: Near it is the Garden of Abode.
translation: عِنْدَهَا جَنَّةُ الْمَأْوَىٰ

phrase: Behold, the Lote-tree was shrouded (in mystery unspeakable!)
translation: إِذْ يَغْشَى السِّدْرَةَ مَا يَغْشَىٰ

phrase: (His) sight never swerved, nor did it go wrong!
translation: مَا زَاغَ الْبَصَرُ وَمَا طَغَىٰ

phrase: For truly did he see, of the Signs of his Lord, the Greatest!
translation: لَقَدْ رَأَىٰ مِنْ آيَاتِ رَبِّهِ الْكُبْرَىٰ

phrase: Have ye seen Lat. and ´Uzza,
translation: أَفَرَأَيْتُمُ اللَّاتَ وَالْعُزَّىٰ

phrase: And another, the third (goddess), Manat?
translation: وَمَنَاةَ الثَّالِثَةَ الْأُخْرَىٰ

phrase: What! for you the male sex, and for Him, the female?
translation: أَلَكُمُ الذَّكَرُ وَلَهُ الْأُنْثَىٰ

phrase: Behold, such would be indeed a division most unfair!
translation: تِلْكَ إِذًا قِسْمَةٌ ضِيزَىٰ

phrase: These are nothing but names which ye have devised,- ye and your fathers,- for which Allah has sent down no authority (whatever). They follow nothing but conjecture and what their own souls desire!- Even though there has already come to them Guidance from their Lord!
translation: إِنْ هِيَ إِلَّا أَسْمَاءٌ سَمَّيْتُمُوهَا أَنْتُمْ وَآبَاؤُكُمْ مَا أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ بِهَا مِنْ سُلْطَانٍ ۚ إِنْ يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ وَمَا تَهْوَى الْأَنْفُسُ ۖ وَلَقَدْ جَاءَهُمْ مِنْ رَبِّهِمُ الْهُدَىٰ

phrase: Nay, shall man have (just) anything he hankers after?
translation: أَمْ لِلْإِنْسَانِ مَا تَمَنَّىٰ

phrase: But it is to Allah that the End and the Beginning (of all things) belong.
translation: فَلِلَّهِ الْآخِرَةُ وَالْأُولَىٰ

phrase: How many-so-ever be the angels in the heavens, their intercession will avail nothing except after Allah has given leave for whom He pleases and that he is acceptable to Him.
translation: وَكَمْ مِنْ مَلَكٍ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ لَا تُغْنِي شَفَاعَتُهُمْ شَيْئًا إِلَّا مِنْ بَعْدِ أَنْ يَأْذَنَ اللَّهُ لِمَنْ يَشَاءُ وَيَرْضَىٰ

phrase: Those who believe not in the Hereafter, name the angels with female names.
translation: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ لَيُسَمُّونَ الْمَلَائِكَةَ تَسْمِيَةَ الْأُنْثَىٰ

phrase: But they have no knowledge therein. They follow nothing but conjecture; and conjecture avails nothing against Truth.
translation: وَمَا لَهُمْ بِهِ مِنْ عِلْمٍ ۖ إِنْ يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ ۖ وَإِنَّ الظَّنَّ لَا يُغْنِي مِنَ الْحَقِّ شَيْئًا

phrase: Therefore shun those who turn away from Our Message and desire nothing but the life of this world.
translation: فَأَعْرِضْ عَنْ مَنْ تَوَلَّىٰ عَنْ ذِكْرِنَا وَلَمْ يُرِدْ إِلَّا الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا

phrase: That is as far as knowledge will reach them. Verily thy Lord knoweth best those who stray from His Path, and He knoweth best those who receive guidance.
translation: ذَٰلِكَ مَبْلَغُهُمْ مِنَ الْعِلْمِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنْ ضَلَّ عَنْ سَبِيلِهِ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ اهْتَدَىٰ

phrase: Yea, to Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth: so that He rewards those who do evil, according to their deeds, and He rewards those who do good, with what is best.
translation: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ لِيَجْزِيَ الَّذِينَ أَسَاءُوا بِمَا عَمِلُوا وَيَجْزِيَ الَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا بِالْحُسْنَى

phrase: Those who avoid great sins and shameful deeds, only (falling into) small faults,- verily thy Lord is ample in forgiveness. He knows you well when He brings you out of the earth, And when ye are hidden in your mothers´ wombs. Therefore justify not yourselves: He knows best who it is that guards against evil.
translation: الَّذِينَ يَجْتَنِبُونَ كَبَائِرَ الْإِثْمِ وَالْفَوَاحِشَ إِلَّا اللَّمَمَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَاسِعُ الْمَغْفِرَةِ ۚ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِكُمْ إِذْ أَنْشَأَكُمْ مِنَ الْأَرْضِ وَإِذْ أَنْتُمْ أَجِنَّةٌ فِي بُطُونِ أُمَّهَاتِكُمْ ۖ فَلَا تُزَكُّوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ ۖ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ اتَّقَىٰ

phrase: Seest thou one who turns back,
translation: أَفَرَأَيْتَ الَّذِي تَوَلَّىٰ

phrase: Gives a little, then hardens (his heart)?
translation: وَأَعْطَىٰ قَلِيلًا وَأَكْدَىٰ

phrase: What! Has he knowledge of the Unseen so that he can see?
translation: أَعِنْدَهُ عِلْمُ الْغَيْبِ فَهُوَ يَرَىٰ

phrase: Nay, is he not acquainted with what is in the Books of Moses-
translation: أَمْ لَمْ يُنَبَّأْ بِمَا فِي صُحُفِ مُوسَىٰ

phrase: And of Abraham who fulfilled his engagements?-
translation: وَإِبْرَاهِيمَ الَّذِي وَفَّىٰ

phrase: Namely, that no bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another;
translation: أَلَّا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ

phrase: That man can have nothing but what he strives for;
translation: وَأَنْ لَيْسَ لِلْإِنْسَانِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ

phrase: That (the fruit of) his striving will soon come in sight:
translation: وَأَنَّ سَعْيَهُ سَوْفَ يُرَىٰ

phrase: Then will he be rewarded with a reward complete;
translation: ثُمَّ يُجْزَاهُ الْجَزَاءَ الْأَوْفَىٰ

phrase: That to thy Lord is the final Goal;
translation: وَأَنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ الْمُنْتَهَىٰ

phrase: That it is He Who granteth Laughter and Tears;
translation: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ أَضْحَكَ وَأَبْكَىٰ

phrase: That it is He Who granteth Death and Life;
translation: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ أَمَاتَ وَأَحْيَا

phrase: That He did create in pairs,- male and female,
translation: وَأَنَّهُ خَلَقَ الزَّوْجَيْنِ الذَّكَرَ وَالْأُنْثَىٰ

phrase: From a seed when lodged (in its place);
translation: مِنْ نُطْفَةٍ إِذَا تُمْنَىٰ

phrase: That He hath promised a Second Creation (Raising of the Dead);
translation: وَأَنَّ عَلَيْهِ النَّشْأَةَ الْأُخْرَىٰ

phrase: That it is He Who giveth wealth and satisfaction;
translation: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ أَغْنَىٰ وَأَقْنَىٰ

phrase: That He is the Lord of Sirius (the Mighty Star);
translation: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ رَبُّ الشِّعْرَىٰ

phrase: And that it is He Who destroyed the (powerful) ancient ´Ad (people),
translation: وَأَنَّهُ أَهْلَكَ عَادًا الْأُولَىٰ

phrase: And the Thamud nor gave them a lease of perpetual life.
translation: وَثَمُودَ فَمَا أَبْقَىٰ

phrase: And before them, the people of Noah, for that they were (all) most unjust and most insolent transgressors,
translation: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِنْ قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا هُمْ أَظْلَمَ وَأَطْغَىٰ

phrase: And He destroyed the Overthrown Cities (of Sodom and Gomorrah).
translation: وَالْمُؤْتَفِكَةَ أَهْوَىٰ

phrase: So that (ruins unknown) have covered them up.
translation: فَغَشَّاهَا مَا غَشَّىٰ

phrase: Then which of the gifts of thy Lord, (O man,) wilt thou dispute about?
translation: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكَ تَتَمَارَىٰ

phrase: This is a Warner, of the (series of) Warners of old!
translation: هَٰذَا نَذِيرٌ مِنَ النُّذُرِ الْأُولَىٰ

phrase: The (Judgment) ever approaching draws nigh:
translation: أَزِفَتِ الْآزِفَةُ

phrase: No (soul) but Allah can lay it bare.
translation: لَيْسَ لَهَا مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ كَاشِفَةٌ

phrase: Do ye then wonder at this recital?
translation: أَفَمِنْ هَٰذَا الْحَدِيثِ تَعْجَبُونَ

phrase: And will ye laugh and not weep,-
translation: وَتَضْحَكُونَ وَلَا تَبْكُونَ

phrase: Wasting your time in vanities?
translation: وَأَنْتُمْ سَامِدُونَ

phrase: But fall ye down in prostration to Allah, and adore (Him)!
translation: فَاسْجُدُوا لِلَّهِ وَاعْبُدُوا ۩

phrase: The Hour (of Judgment) is nigh, and the moon is cleft asunder.
translation: اقْتَرَبَتِ السَّاعَةُ وَانْشَقَّ الْقَمَرُ

phrase: But if they see a Sign, they turn away, and say, "This is (but) transient magic."
translation: وَإِنْ يَرَوْا آيَةً يُعْرِضُوا وَيَقُولُوا سِحْرٌ مُسْتَمِرٌّ

phrase: They reject (the warning) and follow their (own) lusts but every matter has its appointed time.
translation: وَكَذَّبُوا وَاتَّبَعُوا أَهْوَاءَهُمْ ۚ وَكُلُّ أَمْرٍ مُسْتَقِرٌّ

phrase: There have already come to them Recitals wherein there is (enough) to check (them),
translation: وَلَقَدْ جَاءَهُمْ مِنَ الْأَنْبَاءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزْدَجَرٌ

phrase: Mature wisdom;- but (the preaching of) Warners profits them not.
translation: حِكْمَةٌ بَالِغَةٌ ۖ فَمَا تُغْنِ النُّذُرُ

phrase: Therefore, (O Prophet,) turn away from them. The Day that the Caller will call (them) to a terrible affair,
translation: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ ۘ يَوْمَ يَدْعُ الدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَيْءٍ نُكُرٍ

phrase: They will come forth,- their eyes humbled - from (their) graves, (torpid) like locusts scattered abroad,
translation: خُشَّعًا أَبْصَارُهُمْ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمْ جَرَادٌ مُنْتَشِرٌ

phrase: Hastening, with eyes transfixed, towards the Caller!- "Hard is this Day!", the Unbelievers will say.
translation: مُهْطِعِينَ إِلَى الدَّاعِ ۖ يَقُولُ الْكَافِرُونَ هَٰذَا يَوْمٌ عَسِرٌ

phrase: Before them the People of Noah rejected (their messenger): they rejected Our servant, and said, "Here is one possessed!", and he was driven out.
translation: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ فَكَذَّبُوا عَبْدَنَا وَقَالُوا مَجْنُونٌ وَازْدُجِرَ

phrase: Then he called on his Lord: "I am one overcome: do Thou then help (me)!"
translation: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُ أَنِّي مَغْلُوبٌ فَانْتَصِرْ

phrase: So We opened the gates of heaven, with water pouring forth.
translation: فَفَتَحْنَا أَبْوَابَ السَّمَاءِ بِمَاءٍ مُنْهَمِرٍ

phrase: And We caused the earth to gush forth with springs, so the waters met (and rose) to the extent decreed.
translation: وَفَجَّرْنَا الْأَرْضَ عُيُونًا فَالْتَقَى الْمَاءُ عَلَىٰ أَمْرٍ قَدْ قُدِرَ

phrase: But We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fibre:
translation: وَحَمَلْنَاهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلْوَاحٍ وَدُسُرٍ

phrase: She floats under our eyes (and care): a recompense to one who had been rejected (with scorn)!
translation: تَجْرِي بِأَعْيُنِنَا جَزَاءً لِمَنْ كَانَ كُفِرَ

phrase: And We have left this as a Sign (for all time): then is there any that will receive admonition?
translation: وَلَقَدْ تَرَكْنَاهَا آيَةً فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ

phrase: But how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning?
translation: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

phrase: And We have indeed made the Qur´an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
translation: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ

phrase: The ´Ad (people) (too) rejected (Truth): then how terrible was My Penalty and My Warning?
translation: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

phrase: For We sent against them a furious wind, on a Day of violent Disaster,
translation: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِيحًا صَرْصَرًا فِي يَوْمِ نَحْسٍ مُسْتَمِرٍّ

phrase: Plucking out men as if they were roots of palm-trees torn up (from the ground).
translation: تَنْزِعُ النَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ مُنْقَعِرٍ

phrase: The Thamud (also) rejected (their) Warners.
translation: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِالنُّذُرِ

phrase: For they said: "What! a man! a Solitary one from among ourselves! shall we follow such a one? Truly should we then be straying in mind, and mad!
translation: فَقَالُوا أَبَشَرًا مِنَّا وَاحِدًا نَتَّبِعُهُ إِنَّا إِذًا لَفِي ضَلَالٍ وَسُعُرٍ

phrase: "Is it that the Message is sent to him, of all people amongst us? Nay, he is a liar, an insolent one!"
translation: أَأُلْقِيَ الذِّكْرُ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ بَيْنِنَا بَلْ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٌ

phrase: Ah! they will know on the morrow, which is the liar, the insolent one!
translation: سَيَعْلَمُونَ غَدًا مَنِ الْكَذَّابُ الْأَشِرُ

phrase: For We will send the she-camel by way of trial for them. So watch them, (O Salih), and possess thyself in patience!
translation: إِنَّا مُرْسِلُو النَّاقَةِ فِتْنَةً لَهُمْ فَارْتَقِبْهُمْ وَاصْطَبِرْ

phrase: And tell them that the water is to be divided between them: Each one´s right to drink being brought forward (by suitable turns).
translation: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ أَنَّ الْمَاءَ قِسْمَةٌ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ كُلُّ شِرْبٍ مُحْتَضَرٌ

phrase: But they called to their companion, and he took a sword in hand, and hamstrung (her).
translation: فَنَادَوْا صَاحِبَهُمْ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ

phrase: For We sent against them a single Mighty Blast, and they became like the dry stubble used by one who pens cattle.
translation: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً فَكَانُوا كَهَشِيمِ الْمُحْتَظِرِ

phrase: The people of Lut rejected (his) warning.
translation: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍ بِالنُّذُرِ

phrase: We sent against them a violent Tornado with showers of stones, (which destroyed them), except Lut´s household: them We delivered by early Dawn,-
translation: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حَاصِبًا إِلَّا آلَ لُوطٍ ۖ نَجَّيْنَاهُمْ بِسَحَرٍ

phrase: As a Grace from Us: thus do We reward those who give thanks.
translation: نِعْمَةً مِنْ عِنْدِنَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي مَنْ شَكَرَ

phrase: And (Lut) did warn them of Our Punishment, but they disputed about the Warning.
translation: وَلَقَدْ أَنْذَرَهُمْ بَطْشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوْا بِالنُّذُرِ

phrase: And they even sought to snatch away his guests from him, but We blinded their eyes. (They heard:) "Now taste ye My Wrath and My Warning."
translation: وَلَقَدْ رَاوَدُوهُ عَنْ ضَيْفِهِ فَطَمَسْنَا أَعْيُنَهُمْ فَذُوقُوا عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

phrase: Early on the morrow an abiding Punishment seized them:
translation: وَلَقَدْ صَبَّحَهُمْ بُكْرَةً عَذَابٌ مُسْتَقِرٌّ

phrase: "So taste ye My Wrath and My Warning."
translation: فَذُوقُوا عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

phrase: To the People of Pharaoh, too, aforetime, came Warners (from Allah).
translation: وَلَقَدْ جَاءَ آلَ فِرْعَوْنَ النُّذُرُ

phrase: The (people) rejected all Our Signs; but We seized them with such Penalty (as comes) from One Exalted in Power, able to carry out His Will.
translation: كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذْنَاهُمْ أَخْذَ عَزِيزٍ مُقْتَدِرٍ

phrase: Are your Unbelievers, (O Quraish), better than they? Or have ye an immunity in the Sacred Books?
translation: أَكُفَّارُكُمْ خَيْرٌ مِنْ أُولَٰئِكُمْ أَمْ لَكُمْ بَرَاءَةٌ فِي الزُّبُرِ

phrase: Or do they say: "We acting together can defend ourselves"?
translation: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ نَحْنُ جَمِيعٌ مُنْتَصِرٌ

phrase: Soon will their multitude be put to flight, and they will show their backs.
translation: سَيُهْزَمُ الْجَمْعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ الدُّبُرَ

phrase: Nay, the Hour (of Judgment) is the time promised them (for their full recompense): And that Hour will be most grievous and most bitter.
translation: بَلِ السَّاعَةُ مَوْعِدُهُمْ وَالسَّاعَةُ أَدْهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ

phrase: Truly those in sin are the ones straying in mind, and mad.
translation: إِنَّ الْمُجْرِمِينَ فِي ضَلَالٍ وَسُعُرٍ

phrase: The Day they will be dragged through the Fire on their faces, (they will hear:) "Taste ye the touch of Hell!"
translation: يَوْمَ يُسْحَبُونَ فِي النَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ ذُوقُوا مَسَّ سَقَرَ

phrase: Verily, all things have We created in proportion and measure.
translation: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقْنَاهُ بِقَدَرٍ

phrase: And Our Command is but a single (Act),- like the twinkling of an eye.
translation: وَمَا أَمْرُنَا إِلَّا وَاحِدَةٌ كَلَمْحٍ بِالْبَصَرِ

phrase: And (oft) in the past, have We destroyed gangs like unto you: then is there any that will receive admonition?
translation: وَلَقَدْ أَهْلَكْنَا أَشْيَاعَكُمْ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ

phrase: All that they do is noted in (their) Books (of Deeds):
translation: وَكُلُّ شَيْءٍ فَعَلُوهُ فِي الزُّبُرِ

phrase: Every matter, small and great, is on record.
translation: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٍ وَكَبِيرٍ مُسْتَطَرٌ

phrase: As to the Righteous, they will be in the midst of Gardens and Rivers,
translation: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَنَهَرٍ

phrase: In an Assembly of Truth, in the Presence of a Sovereign Omnipotent.
translation: فِي مَقْعَدِ صِدْقٍ عِنْدَ مَلِيكٍ مُقْتَدِرٍ

phrase: (Allah) Most Gracious!
translation: الرَّحْمَٰنُ

phrase: It is He Who has taught the Qur´an.
translation: عَلَّمَ الْقُرْآنَ

phrase: He has created man:
translation: خَلَقَ الْإِنْسَانَ

phrase: He has taught him speech (and intelligence).
translation: عَلَّمَهُ الْبَيَانَ

phrase: The sun and the moon follow courses (exactly) computed;
translation: الشَّمْسُ وَالْقَمَرُ بِحُسْبَانٍ

phrase: And the herbs and the trees - both (alike) prostrate in adoration.
translation: وَالنَّجْمُ وَالشَّجَرُ يَسْجُدَانِ

phrase: And the Firmament has He raised high, and He has set up the Balance (of Justice),
translation: وَالسَّمَاءَ رَفَعَهَا وَوَضَعَ الْمِيزَانَ

phrase: In order that ye may not transgress (due) balance.
translation: أَلَّا تَطْغَوْا فِي الْمِيزَانِ

phrase: So establish weight with justice and fall not short in the balance.
translation: وَأَقِيمُوا الْوَزْنَ بِالْقِسْطِ وَلَا تُخْسِرُوا الْمِيزَانَ

phrase: It is He Who has spread out the earth for (His) creatures:
translation: وَالْأَرْضَ وَضَعَهَا لِلْأَنَامِ

phrase: Therein is fruit and date-palms, producing spathes (enclosing dates);
translation: فِيهَا فَاكِهَةٌ وَالنَّخْلُ ذَاتُ الْأَكْمَامِ

phrase: Also corn, with (its) leaves and stalk for fodder, and sweet-smelling plants.
translation: وَالْحَبُّ ذُو الْعَصْفِ وَالرَّيْحَانُ

phrase: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
translation: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

phrase: He created man from sounding clay like unto pottery,
translation: خَلَقَ الْإِنْسَانَ مِنْ صَلْصَالٍ كَالْفَخَّارِ

phrase: And He created Jinns from fire free of smoke:
translation: وَخَلَقَ الْجَانَّ مِنْ مَارِجٍ مِنْ نَارٍ

phrase: (He is) Lord of the two Easts and Lord of the two Wests:
translation: رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقَيْنِ وَرَبُّ الْمَغْرِبَيْنِ

phrase: He has let free the two bodies of flowing water, meeting together:
translation: مَرَجَ الْبَحْرَيْنِ يَلْتَقِيَانِ

phrase: Between them is a Barrier which they do not transgress:
translation: بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخٌ لَا يَبْغِيَانِ

phrase: Out of them come Pearls and Coral:
translation: يَخْرُجُ مِنْهُمَا اللُّؤْلُؤُ وَالْمَرْجَانُ

phrase: And His are the Ships sailing smoothly through the seas, lofty as mountains:
translation: وَلَهُ الْجَوَارِ الْمُنْشَآتُ فِي الْبَحْرِ كَالْأَعْلَامِ

phrase: All that is on earth will perish:
translation: كُلُّ مَنْ عَلَيْهَا فَانٍ

phrase: But will abide (for ever) the Face of thy Lord,- full of Majesty, Bounty and Honour.
translation: وَيَبْقَىٰ وَجْهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ

phrase: Of Him seeks (its need) every creature in the heavens and on earth: every day in (new) Splendour doth He (shine)!
translation: يَسْأَلُهُ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ هُوَ فِي شَأْنٍ

phrase: Soon shall We settle your affairs, O both ye worlds!
translation: سَنَفْرُغُ لَكُمْ أَيُّهَ الثَّقَلَانِ

phrase: O ye assembly of Jinns and men! If it be ye can pass beyond the zones of the heavens and the earth, pass ye! not without authority shall ye be able to pass!
translation: يَا مَعْشَرَ الْجِنِّ وَالْإِنْسِ إِنِ اسْتَطَعْتُمْ أَنْ تَنْفُذُوا مِنْ أَقْطَارِ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ فَانْفُذُوا ۚ لَا تَنْفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلْطَانٍ

phrase: On you will be sent (O ye evil ones twain!) a flame of fire (to burn) and a smoke (to choke): no defence will ye have:
translation: يُرْسَلُ عَلَيْكُمَا شُوَاظٌ مِنْ نَارٍ وَنُحَاسٌ فَلَا تَنْتَصِرَانِ

phrase: When the sky is rent asunder, and it becomes red like ointment:
translation: فَإِذَا انْشَقَّتِ السَّمَاءُ فَكَانَتْ وَرْدَةً كَالدِّهَانِ

phrase: On that Day no question will be asked of man or Jinn as to his sin.
translation: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَا يُسْأَلُ عَنْ ذَنْبِهِ إِنْسٌ وَلَا جَانٌّ

phrase: (For) the sinners will be known by their marks: and they will be seized by their forelocks and their feet.
translation: يُعْرَفُ الْمُجْرِمُونَ بِسِيمَاهُمْ فَيُؤْخَذُ بِالنَّوَاصِي وَالْأَقْدَامِ

phrase: This is the Hell which the Sinners deny:
translation: هَٰذِهِ جَهَنَّمُ الَّتِي يُكَذِّبُ بِهَا الْمُجْرِمُونَ

phrase: In its midst and in the midst of boiling hot water will they wander round!
translation: يَطُوفُونَ بَيْنَهَا وَبَيْنَ حَمِيمٍ آنٍ

phrase: But for such as fear the time when they will stand before (the Judgment Seat of) their Lord, there will be two Gardens-
translation: وَلِمَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِ جَنَّتَانِ

phrase: Containing all kinds (of trees and delights);-
translation: ذَوَاتَا أَفْنَانٍ

phrase: In them (each) will be two Springs flowing (free);
translation: فِيهِمَا عَيْنَانِ تَجْرِيَانِ

phrase: In them will be Fruits of every kind, two and two.
translation: فِيهِمَا مِنْ كُلِّ فَاكِهَةٍ زَوْجَانِ

phrase: They will recline on Carpets, whose inner linings will be of rich brocade: the Fruit of the Gardens will be near (and easy of reach).
translation: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشٍ بَطَائِنُهَا مِنْ إِسْتَبْرَقٍ ۚ وَجَنَى الْجَنَّتَيْنِ دَانٍ

phrase: In them will be (Maidens), chaste, restraining their glances, whom no man or Jinn before them has touched;-
translation: فِيهِنَّ قَاصِرَاتُ الطَّرْفِ لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنْسٌ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَانٌّ

phrase: Like unto Rubies and coral.
translation: كَأَنَّهُنَّ الْيَاقُوتُ وَالْمَرْجَانُ

phrase: Is there any Reward for Good - other than Good?
translation: هَلْ جَزَاءُ الْإِحْسَانِ إِلَّا الْإِحْسَانُ

phrase: And besides these two, there are two other Gardens,-
translation: وَمِنْ دُونِهِمَا جَنَّتَانِ

phrase: Dark-green in colour (from plentiful watering).
translation: مُدْهَامَّتَانِ

phrase: In them (each) will be two Springs pouring forth water in continuous abundance:
translation: فِيهِمَا عَيْنَانِ نَضَّاخَتَانِ

phrase: In them will be Fruits, and dates and pomegranates:
translation: فِيهِمَا فَاكِهَةٌ وَنَخْلٌ وَرُمَّانٌ

phrase: In them will be fair (Companions), good, beautiful;-
translation: فِيهِنَّ خَيْرَاتٌ حِسَانٌ

phrase: Companions restrained (as to their glances), in (goodly) pavilions;-
translation: حُورٌ مَقْصُورَاتٌ فِي الْخِيَامِ

phrase: Whom no man or Jinn before them has touched;-
translation: لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنْسٌ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَانٌّ

phrase: Reclining on green Cushions and rich Carpets of beauty.
translation: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ رَفْرَفٍ خُضْرٍ وَعَبْقَرِيٍّ حِسَانٍ

phrase: Blessed be the name of thy Lord, full of Majesty, Bounty and Honour.
translation: تَبَارَكَ اسْمُ رَبِّكَ ذِي الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ

phrase: When the Event inevitable cometh to pass,
translation: إِذَا وَقَعَتِ الْوَاقِعَةُ

phrase: Then will no (soul) entertain falsehood concerning its coming.
translation: لَيْسَ لِوَقْعَتِهَا كَاذِبَةٌ

phrase: (Many) will it bring low; (many) will it exalt;
translation: خَافِضَةٌ رَافِعَةٌ

phrase: When the earth shall be shaken to its depths,
translation: إِذَا رُجَّتِ الْأَرْضُ رَجًّا

phrase: And the mountains shall be crumbled to atoms,
translation: وَبُسَّتِ الْجِبَالُ بَسًّا

phrase: Becoming dust scattered abroad,
translation: فَكَانَتْ هَبَاءً مُنْبَثًّا

phrase: And ye shall be sorted out into three classes.
translation: وَكُنْتُمْ أَزْوَاجًا ثَلَاثَةً

phrase: Then (there will be) the Companions of the Right Hand;- What will be the Companions of the Right Hand?
translation: فَأَصْحَابُ الْمَيْمَنَةِ مَا أَصْحَابُ الْمَيْمَنَةِ

phrase: And the Companions of the Left Hand,- what will be the Companions of the Left Hand?
translation: وَأَصْحَابُ الْمَشْأَمَةِ مَا أَصْحَابُ الْمَشْأَمَةِ

phrase: And those Foremost (in Faith) will be Foremost (in the Hereafter).
translation: وَالسَّابِقُونَ السَّابِقُونَ

phrase: These will be those Nearest to Allah:
translation: أُولَٰئِكَ الْمُقَرَّبُونَ

phrase: A number of people from those of old,
translation: ثُلَّةٌ مِنَ الْأَوَّلِينَ

phrase: And a few from those of later times.
translation: وَقَلِيلٌ مِنَ الْآخِرِينَ

phrase: (They will be) on Thrones encrusted (with gold and precious stones),
translation: عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَوْضُونَةٍ

phrase: Reclining on them, facing each other.
translation: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَيْهَا مُتَقَابِلِينَ

phrase: Round about them will (serve) youths of perpetual (freshness),
translation: يَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَانٌ مُخَلَّدُونَ

phrase: With goblets, (shining) beakers, and cups (filled) out of clear-flowing fountains:
translation: بِأَكْوَابٍ وَأَبَارِيقَ وَكَأْسٍ مِنْ مَعِينٍ

phrase: No after-ache will they receive therefrom, nor will they suffer intoxication:
translation: لَا يُصَدَّعُونَ عَنْهَا وَلَا يُنْزِفُونَ

phrase: And with fruits, any that they may select:
translation: وَفَاكِهَةٍ مِمَّا يَتَخَيَّرُونَ

phrase: And the flesh of fowls, any that they may desire.
translation: وَلَحْمِ طَيْرٍ مِمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ

phrase: And (there will be) Companions with beautiful, big, and lustrous eyes,-
translation: وَحُورٌ عِينٌ

phrase: Like unto Pearls well-guarded.
translation: كَأَمْثَالِ اللُّؤْلُؤِ الْمَكْنُونِ

phrase: A Reward for the deeds of their past (life).
translation: جَزَاءً بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ

phrase: Not frivolity will they hear therein, nor any taint of ill,-
translation: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا تَأْثِيمًا

phrase: Only the saying, "Peace! Peace".
translation: إِلَّا قِيلًا سَلَامًا سَلَامًا

phrase: The Companions of the Right Hand,- what will be the Companions of the Right Hand?
translation: وَأَصْحَابُ الْيَمِينِ مَا أَصْحَابُ الْيَمِينِ

phrase: (They will be) among Lote-trees without thorns,
translation: فِي سِدْرٍ مَخْضُودٍ

phrase: Among Talh trees with flowers (or fruits) piled one above another,-
translation: وَطَلْحٍ مَنْضُودٍ

phrase: In shade long-extended,
translation: وَظِلٍّ مَمْدُودٍ

phrase: By water flowing constantly,
translation: وَمَاءٍ مَسْكُوبٍ

phrase: And fruit in abundance.
translation: وَفَاكِهَةٍ كَثِيرَةٍ

phrase: Whose season is not limited, nor (supply) forbidden,
translation: لَا مَقْطُوعَةٍ وَلَا مَمْنُوعَةٍ

phrase: And on Thrones (of Dignity), raised high.
translation: وَفُرُشٍ مَرْفُوعَةٍ

phrase: We have created (their Companions) of special creation.
translation: إِنَّا أَنْشَأْنَاهُنَّ إِنْشَاءً

phrase: And made them virgin - pure (and undefiled), -
translation: فَجَعَلْنَاهُنَّ أَبْكَارًا

phrase: Beloved (by nature), equal in age,-
translation: عُرُبًا أَتْرَابًا

phrase: For the Companions of the Right Hand.
translation: لِأَصْحَابِ الْيَمِينِ

phrase: And a (goodly) number from those of later times.
translation: وَثُلَّةٌ مِنَ الْآخِرِينَ

phrase: The Companions of the Left Hand,- what will be the Companions of the Left Hand?
translation: وَأَصْحَابُ الشِّمَالِ مَا أَصْحَابُ الشِّمَالِ

phrase: (They will be) in the midst of a Fierce Blast of Fire and in Boiling Water,
translation: فِي سَمُومٍ وَحَمِيمٍ

phrase: And in the shades of Black Smoke:
translation: وَظِلٍّ مِنْ يَحْمُومٍ

phrase: Nothing (will there be) to refresh, nor to please:
translation: لَا بَارِدٍ وَلَا كَرِيمٍ

phrase: For that they were wont to be indulged, before that, in wealth (and luxury),
translation: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُتْرَفِينَ

phrase: And persisted obstinately in wickedness supreme!
translation: وَكَانُوا يُصِرُّونَ عَلَى الْحِنْثِ الْعَظِيمِ

phrase: And they used to say, "What! when we die and become dust and bones, shall we then indeed be raised up again?-
translation: وَكَانُوا يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ

phrase: Say: "Yea, those of old and those of later times,
translation: قُلْ إِنَّ الْأَوَّلِينَ وَالْآخِرِينَ

phrase: "All will certainly be gathered together for the meeting appointed for a Day well-known.
translation: لَمَجْمُوعُونَ إِلَىٰ مِيقَاتِ يَوْمٍ مَعْلُومٍ

phrase: "Then will ye truly,- O ye that go wrong, and treat (Truth) as Falsehood!-
translation: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمْ أَيُّهَا الضَّالُّونَ الْمُكَذِّبُونَ

phrase: "Ye will surely taste of the Tree of Zaqqum.
translation: لَآكِلُونَ مِنْ شَجَرٍ مِنْ زَقُّومٍ

phrase: "Then will ye fill your insides therewith,
translation: فَمَالِئُونَ مِنْهَا الْبُطُونَ

phrase: "And drink Boiling Water on top of it:
translation: فَشَارِبُونَ عَلَيْهِ مِنَ الْحَمِيمِ

phrase: "Indeed ye shall drink like diseased camels raging with thirst!"
translation: فَشَارِبُونَ شُرْبَ الْهِيمِ

phrase: Such will be their entertainment on the Day of Requital!
translation: هَٰذَا نُزُلُهُمْ يَوْمَ الدِّينِ

phrase: It is We Who have created you: why will ye not witness the Truth?
translation: نَحْنُ خَلَقْنَاكُمْ فَلَوْلَا تُصَدِّقُونَ

phrase: Do ye then see?- The (human Seed) that ye throw out,-
translation: أَفَرَأَيْتُمْ مَا تُمْنُونَ

phrase: Is it ye who create it, or are We the Creators?
translation: أَأَنْتُمْ تَخْلُقُونَهُ أَمْ نَحْنُ الْخَالِقُونَ

phrase: We have decreed Death to be your common lot, and We are not to be frustrated
translation: نَحْنُ قَدَّرْنَا بَيْنَكُمُ الْمَوْتَ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ

phrase: from changing your Forms and creating you (again) in (forms) that ye know not.
translation: عَلَىٰ أَنْ نُبَدِّلَ أَمْثَالَكُمْ وَنُنْشِئَكُمْ فِي مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ

phrase: And ye certainly know already the first form of creation: why then do ye not celebrate His praises?
translation: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْتُمُ النَّشْأَةَ الْأُولَىٰ فَلَوْلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ

phrase: See ye the seed that ye sow in the ground?
translation: أَفَرَأَيْتُمْ مَا تَحْرُثُونَ

phrase: Is it ye that cause it to grow, or are We the Cause?
translation: أَأَنْتُمْ تَزْرَعُونَهُ أَمْ نَحْنُ الزَّارِعُونَ

phrase: Were it Our Will, We could crumble it to dry powder, and ye would be left in wonderment,
translation: لَوْ نَشَاءُ لَجَعَلْنَاهُ حُطَامًا فَظَلْتُمْ تَفَكَّهُونَ

phrase: (Saying), "We are indeed left with debts (for nothing):
translation: إِنَّا لَمُغْرَمُونَ

phrase: "Indeed are we shut out (of the fruits of our labour)"
translation: بَلْ نَحْنُ مَحْرُومُونَ

phrase: See ye the water which ye drink?
translation: أَفَرَأَيْتُمُ الْمَاءَ الَّذِي تَشْرَبُونَ

phrase: Do ye bring it down (in rain) from the cloud or do We?
translation: أَأَنْتُمْ أَنْزَلْتُمُوهُ مِنَ الْمُزْنِ أَمْ نَحْنُ الْمُنْزِلُونَ

phrase: Were it Our Will, We could make it salt (and unpalatable): then why do ye not give thanks?
translation: لَوْ نَشَاءُ جَعَلْنَاهُ أُجَاجًا فَلَوْلَا تَشْكُرُونَ

phrase: See ye the Fire which ye kindle?
translation: أَفَرَأَيْتُمُ النَّارَ الَّتِي تُورُونَ

phrase: Is it ye who grow the tree which feeds the fire, or do We grow it?
translation: أَأَنْتُمْ أَنْشَأْتُمْ شَجَرَتَهَا أَمْ نَحْنُ الْمُنْشِئُونَ

phrase: We have made it a memorial (of Our handiwork), and an article of comfort and convenience for the denizens of deserts.
translation: نَحْنُ جَعَلْنَاهَا تَذْكِرَةً وَمَتَاعًا لِلْمُقْوِينَ

phrase: Then celebrate with praises the name of thy Lord, the Supreme!
translation: فَسَبِّحْ بِاسْمِ رَبِّكَ الْعَظِيمِ

phrase: Furthermore I call to witness the setting of the Stars,-
translation: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِمَوَاقِعِ النُّجُومِ

phrase: And that is indeed a mighty adjuration if ye but knew,-
translation: وَإِنَّهُ لَقَسَمٌ لَوْ تَعْلَمُونَ عَظِيمٌ

phrase: That this is indeed a qur´an Most Honourable,
translation: إِنَّهُ لَقُرْآنٌ كَرِيمٌ

phrase: In Book well-guarded,
translation: فِي كِتَابٍ مَكْنُونٍ

phrase: Which none shall touch but those who are clean:
translation: لَا يَمَسُّهُ إِلَّا الْمُطَهَّرُونَ

phrase: A Revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.
translation: تَنْزِيلٌ مِنْ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

phrase: Is it such a Message that ye would hold in light esteem?
translation: أَفَبِهَٰذَا الْحَدِيثِ أَنْتُمْ مُدْهِنُونَ

phrase: And have ye made it your livelihood that ye should declare it false?
translation: وَتَجْعَلُونَ رِزْقَكُمْ أَنَّكُمْ تُكَذِّبُونَ

phrase: Then why do ye not (intervene) when (the soul of the dying man) reaches the throat,-
translation: فَلَوْلَا إِذَا بَلَغَتِ الْحُلْقُومَ

phrase: And ye the while (sit) looking on,-
translation: وَأَنْتُمْ حِينَئِذٍ تَنْظُرُونَ

phrase: But We are nearer to him than ye, and yet see not,-
translation: وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنْكُمْ وَلَٰكِنْ لَا تُبْصِرُونَ

phrase: Then why do ye not,- If you are exempt from (future) account,-
translation: فَلَوْلَا إِنْ كُنْتُمْ غَيْرَ مَدِينِينَ

phrase: Call back the soul, if ye are true (in the claim of independence)?
translation: تَرْجِعُونَهَا إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ

phrase: Thus, then, if he be of those Nearest to Allah,
translation: فَأَمَّا إِنْ كَانَ مِنَ الْمُقَرَّبِينَ

phrase: (There is for him) Rest and Satisfaction, and a Garden of Delights.
translation: فَرَوْحٌ وَرَيْحَانٌ وَجَنَّتُ نَعِيمٍ

phrase: And if he be of the Companions of the Right Hand,
translation: وَأَمَّا إِنْ كَانَ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ الْيَمِينِ

phrase: (For him is the salutation), "Peace be unto thee", from the Companions of the Right Hand.
translation: فَسَلَامٌ لَكَ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ الْيَمِينِ

phrase: And if he be of those who treat (Truth) as Falsehood, who go wrong,
translation: وَأَمَّا إِنْ كَانَ مِنَ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ الضَّالِّينَ

phrase: For him is Entertainment with Boiling Water.
translation: فَنُزُلٌ مِنْ حَمِيمٍ

phrase: And burning in Hell-Fire.
translation: وَتَصْلِيَةُ جَحِيمٍ

phrase: Verily, this is the Very Truth and Certainly.
translation: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ حَقُّ الْيَقِينِ

phrase: Whatever is in the heavens and on earth,- let it declare the Praises and Glory of Allah: for He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
translation: سَبَّحَ لِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ

phrase: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: It is He Who gives Life and Death; and He has Power over all things.
translation: لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ يُحْيِي وَيُمِيتُ ۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ

phrase: He is the First and the Last, the Evident and the Immanent: and He has full knowledge of all things.
translation: هُوَ الْأَوَّلُ وَالْآخِرُ وَالظَّاهِرُ وَالْبَاطِنُ ۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ

phrase: He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in Six Days, and is moreover firmly established on the Throne (of Authority). He knows what enters within the earth and what comes forth out of it, what comes down from heaven and what mounts up to it. And He is with you wheresoever ye may be. And Allah sees well all that ye do.
translation: هُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ اسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ ۚ يَعْلَمُ مَا يَلِجُ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَمَا يَخْرُجُ مِنْهَا وَمَا يَنْزِلُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ وَمَا يَعْرُجُ فِيهَا ۖ وَهُوَ مَعَكُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ

phrase: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: and all affairs are referred back to Allah.
translation: لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ تُرْجَعُ الْأُمُورُ

phrase: He merges Night into Day, and He merges Day into Night; and He has full knowledge of the secrets of (all) hearts.
translation: يُولِجُ اللَّيْلَ فِي النَّهَارِ وَيُولِجُ النَّهَارَ فِي اللَّيْلِ ۚ وَهُوَ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ

phrase: Believe in Allah and His messenger, and spend (in charity) out of the (substance) whereof He has made you heirs. For, those of you who believe and spend (in charity),- for them is a great Reward.
translation: آمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ وَأَنْفِقُوا مِمَّا جَعَلَكُمْ مُسْتَخْلَفِينَ فِيهِ ۖ فَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مِنْكُمْ وَأَنْفَقُوا لَهُمْ أَجْرٌ كَبِيرٌ

phrase: What cause have ye why ye should not believe in Allah?- and the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord, and has indeed taken your Covenant, if ye are men of Faith.
translation: وَمَا لَكُمْ لَا تُؤْمِنُونَ بِاللَّهِ ۙ وَالرَّسُولُ يَدْعُوكُمْ لِتُؤْمِنُوا بِرَبِّكُمْ وَقَدْ أَخَذَ مِيثَاقَكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

phrase: He is the One Who sends to His Servant Manifest Signs, that He may lead you from the depths of Darkness into the Light and verily Allah is to you most kind and Merciful.
translation: هُوَ الَّذِي يُنَزِّلُ عَلَىٰ عَبْدِهِ آيَاتٍ بَيِّنَاتٍ لِيُخْرِجَكُمْ مِنَ الظُّلُمَاتِ إِلَى النُّورِ ۚ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ بِكُمْ لَرَءُوفٌ رَحِيمٌ

phrase: And what cause have ye why ye should not spend in the cause of Allah?- For to Allah belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth. Not equal among you are those who spent (freely) and fought, before the Victory, (with those who did so later). Those are higher in rank than those who spent (freely) and fought afterwards. But to all has Allah promised a goodly (reward). And Allah is well acquainted with all that ye do.
translation: وَمَا لَكُمْ أَلَّا تُنْفِقُوا فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ وَلِلَّهِ مِيرَاثُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ لَا يَسْتَوِي مِنْكُمْ مَنْ أَنْفَقَ مِنْ قَبْلِ الْفَتْحِ وَقَاتَلَ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ أَعْظَمُ دَرَجَةً مِنَ الَّذِينَ أَنْفَقُوا مِنْ بَعْدُ وَقَاتَلُوا ۚ وَكُلًّا وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الْحُسْنَىٰ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌ

phrase: Who is he that will Loan to Allah a beautiful loan? for (Allah) will increase it manifold to his credit, and he will have (besides) a liberal Reward.
translation: مَنْ ذَا الَّذِي يُقْرِضُ اللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا فَيُضَاعِفَهُ لَهُ وَلَهُ أَجْرٌ كَرِيمٌ

phrase: One Day shalt thou see the believing men and the believing women- how their Light runs forward before them and by their right hands: (their greeting will be): "Good News for you this Day! Gardens beneath which flow rivers! to dwell therein for aye! This is indeed the highest Achievement!"
translation: يَوْمَ تَرَى الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ يَسْعَىٰ نُورُهُمْ بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَبِأَيْمَانِهِمْ بُشْرَاكُمُ الْيَوْمَ جَنَّاتٌ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ

phrase: One Day will the Hypocrites- men and women - say to the Believers: "Wait for us! Let us borrow (a Light) from your Light!" It will be said: "Turn ye back to your rear! then seek a Light (where ye can)!" So a wall will be put up betwixt them, with a gate therein. Within it will be Mercy throughout, and without it, all alongside, will be (Wrath and) Punishment!
translation: يَوْمَ يَقُولُ الْمُنَافِقُونَ وَالْمُنَافِقَاتُ لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا انْظُرُونَا نَقْتَبِسْ مِنْ نُورِكُمْ قِيلَ ارْجِعُوا وَرَاءَكُمْ فَالْتَمِسُوا نُورًا فَضُرِبَ بَيْنَهُمْ بِسُورٍ لَهُ بَابٌ بَاطِنُهُ فِيهِ الرَّحْمَةُ وَظَاهِرُهُ مِنْ قِبَلِهِ الْعَذَابُ

phrase: (Those without) will call out, "Were we not with you?" (The others) will reply, "True! but ye led yourselves into temptation; ye looked forward (to our ruin); ye doubted (Allah´s Promise); and (your false) desires deceived you; until there issued the Command of Allah. And the Deceiver deceived you in respect of Allah.
translation: يُنَادُونَهُمْ أَلَمْ نَكُنْ مَعَكُمْ ۖ قَالُوا بَلَىٰ وَلَٰكِنَّكُمْ فَتَنْتُمْ أَنْفُسَكُمْ وَتَرَبَّصْتُمْ وَارْتَبْتُمْ وَغَرَّتْكُمُ الْأَمَانِيُّ حَتَّىٰ جَاءَ أَمْرُ اللَّهِ وَغَرَّكُمْ بِاللَّهِ الْغَرُورُ

phrase: "This Day shall no ransom be accepted of you, nor of those who rejected Allah." Your abode is the Fire: that is the proper place to claim you: and an evil refuge it is!"
translation: فَالْيَوْمَ لَا يُؤْخَذُ مِنْكُمْ فِدْيَةٌ وَلَا مِنَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا ۚ مَأْوَاكُمُ النَّارُ ۖ هِيَ مَوْلَاكُمْ ۖ وَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ

phrase: Has not the Time arrived for the Believers that their hearts in all humility should engage in the remembrance of Allah and of the Truth which has been revealed (to them), and that they should not become like those to whom was given Revelation aforetime, but long ages passed over them and their hearts grew hard? For many among them are rebellious transgressors.
translation: أَلَمْ يَأْنِ لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا أَنْ تَخْشَعَ قُلُوبُهُمْ لِذِكْرِ اللَّهِ وَمَا نَزَلَ مِنَ الْحَقِّ وَلَا يَكُونُوا كَالَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ مِنْ قَبْلُ فَطَالَ عَلَيْهِمُ الْأَمَدُ فَقَسَتْ قُلُوبُهُمْ ۖ وَكَثِيرٌ مِنْهُمْ فَاسِقُونَ

phrase: Know ye (all) that Allah giveth life to the earth after its death! already have We shown the Signs plainly to you, that ye may learn wisdom.
translation: اعْلَمُوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُحْيِي الْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا ۚ قَدْ بَيَّنَّا لَكُمُ الْآيَاتِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ

phrase: For those who give in Charity, men and women, and loan to Allah a Beautiful Loan, it shall be increased manifold (to their credit), and they shall have (besides) a liberal reward.
translation: إِنَّ الْمُصَّدِّقِينَ وَالْمُصَّدِّقَاتِ وَأَقْرَضُوا اللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا يُضَاعَفُ لَهُمْ وَلَهُمْ أَجْرٌ كَرِيمٌ

phrase: And those who believe in Allah and His messengers- they are the Sincere (lovers of Truth), and the witnesses (who testify), in the eyes of their Lord: They shall have their Reward and their Light. But those who reject Allah and deny Our Signs,- they are the Companions of Hell-Fire.
translation: وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الصِّدِّيقُونَ ۖ وَالشُّهَدَاءُ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ لَهُمْ أَجْرُهُمْ وَنُورُهُمْ ۖ وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَكَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا أُولَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ الْجَحِيمِ

phrase: Know ye (all), that the life of this world is but play and amusement, pomp and mutual boasting and multiplying, (in rivalry) among yourselves, riches and children. Here is a similitude: How rain and the growth which it brings forth, delight (the hearts of) the tillers; soon it withers; thou wilt see it grow yellow; then it becomes dry and crumbles away. But in the Hereafter is a Penalty severe (for the devotees of wrong). And Forgiveness from Allah and (His) Good Pleasure (for the devotees of Allah). And what is the life of this world, but goods and chattels of deception?
translation: اعْلَمُوا أَنَّمَا الْحَيَاةُ الدُّنْيَا لَعِبٌ وَلَهْوٌ وَزِينَةٌ وَتَفَاخُرٌ بَيْنَكُمْ وَتَكَاثُرٌ فِي الْأَمْوَالِ وَالْأَوْلَادِ ۖ كَمَثَلِ غَيْثٍ أَعْجَبَ الْكُفَّارَ نَبَاتُهُ ثُمَّ يَهِيجُ فَتَرَاهُ مُصْفَرًّا ثُمَّ يَكُونُ حُطَامًا ۖ وَفِي الْآخِرَةِ عَذَابٌ شَدِيدٌ وَمَغْفِرَةٌ مِنَ اللَّهِ وَرِضْوَانٌ ۚ وَمَا الْحَيَاةُ الدُّنْيَا إِلَّا مَتَاعُ الْغُرُورِ

phrase: Be ye foremost (in seeking) Forgiveness from your Lord, and a Garden (of Bliss), the width whereof is as the width of heaven and earth, prepared for those who believe in Allah and His messengers: that is the Grace of Allah, which He bestows on whom he pleases: and Allah is the Lord of Grace abounding.
translation: سَابِقُوا إِلَىٰ مَغْفِرَةٍ مِنْ رَبِّكُمْ وَجَنَّةٍ عَرْضُهَا كَعَرْضِ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ أُعِدَّتْ لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ فَضْلُ اللَّهِ يُؤْتِيهِ مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ ذُو الْفَضْلِ الْعَظِيمِ

phrase: No misfortune can happen on earth or in your souls but is recorded in a decree before We bring it into existence: That is truly easy for Allah:
translation: مَا أَصَابَ مِنْ مُصِيبَةٍ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِي أَنْفُسِكُمْ إِلَّا فِي كِتَابٍ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ نَبْرَأَهَا ۚ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ يَسِيرٌ

phrase: In order that ye may not despair over matters that pass you by, nor exult over favours bestowed upon you. For Allah loveth not any vainglorious boaster,-
translation: لِكَيْلَا تَأْسَوْا عَلَىٰ مَا فَاتَكُمْ وَلَا تَفْرَحُوا بِمَا آتَاكُمْ ۗ وَاللَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ مُخْتَالٍ فَخُورٍ

phrase: Such persons as are covetous and commend covetousness to men. And if any turn back (from Allah´s Way), verily Allah is Free of all Needs, Worthy of all Praise.
translation: الَّذِينَ يَبْخَلُونَ وَيَأْمُرُونَ النَّاسَ بِالْبُخْلِ ۗ وَمَنْ يَتَوَلَّ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الْغَنِيُّ الْحَمِيدُ
